reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just put in for my 3rd order
reviewText: I have 2 already and just order a 3rd. My second Chromebook did not come with the stylus/pen and the seller quickly shipped me the stylus/pen. This is a great Chromebook for all our basic needs. I use mine on flights to get some work done. I really like the tent/tablet mode for watching videos. Some of my favorite apps are also available on this Chromebook. The seller is very good to work with and I just ordered one more for my daughter. The quality is what you would expect for a used educational edition Chromebook. Some buyers expect that theirs will be flawless. So far on all of mine the screen has been scratch free. Once I get them I clean them really well and even put a coat of armor all on the housing to shine it back up. Both of the Chromebooks I have received have been in excellent condition and fully functional. These things have 4gb of ram and a roughly 2.5ghz quad core processor, so apps run very smooth. Video quality is great, but I'm not sure what resolution the screen is. I recommend the 500e to anyone looking for a cheap Chromebook suitable for browsing, watching videos, and playing the occasional games.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars SUPER UNHAPPY!!!
reviewText: I have ordered 3 of these. The first one I ordered looked in very good condition, and worked well but stopped working after about a month, and due to a problem with my Amazon account I can no longer access it to make a return (have to use husband's account now). I then ordered 2 more, and when they came I realized that my 1st order hadn't even been the correct item! Only 1 of the 3 was actually a 2nd gen!!! These last 2 came in pretty bad physical condition. I bought it renewed in excellent condition, which should be close to new looking. Faaaaaar from it! I'm keeping the one that is actually the correct product, because (so far) it's working correctly. I'm putting a case over it, so the scratches all over won't be a big deal. What IS a big deal is the other one that came. Not only was it not a 2nd generation, as ordered, and it was extremely worn and scratched all over (even the keys had heavy wear) but it is even CRACKED on one corner, and the glass screen is popping out on that corner, too! This company is doing a terrible job, and I'm returning the worst of the last 2 as soon as I can. I'm hesitant to ask for a replacement because who knows what I'll receive this time. My expectations aren't as high as most. All I wanted was for them to be the correct item, not look like they've been thrown on concrete over and over, and work properly. Sadly, they can't even live up to this, despite selling these claiming they've been renewed to excellent.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent deal
reviewText: This has worked very well for the price especially. Does everything I needed it for. Touch screen and pivot function are an extra bonus. Only slightly cosmetic wear to the outside. Happy with purchase.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great Product! Deceptive Product Page!!
reviewText: First the good: I received my Chromebook in excellent condition! Considering its age, it looked like new and has great performance. Not one scratch or blemish on it. 2 in 1 touch screen works perfectly. No issues with hinges when placing it in tablet mode. All keys worked. Not mentioned on product page is that it had 4 ports (2 USB C style and 2 older style) and a micro SD slot. All of which work fine. Now the bad and my only complaint: The product page list this Chromebook as being released on 6/16/2022. I purchased this Chromebook based on this information. When I first turned it on, I checked through OS settings and saw that the Auto Update Expiration date is 6/2027. Only 3 years from now. Upon further investigation, I found out that this device was released in 6/2018. IMO, This is very DECEPTIVE!! I purchased this item based on the listed release date on the product page. If I had known it was 2018, I would have purchased a newer, i.e., 2020, renewed Chromebook I saw out there. Lesson learned for me. I would have given this product 5 stars, it really is in excellent condition, but due to the deception, I am knocking it down to 3, and debating whether to keep it or return it. I also wasn’t pleased that a few hours after ordering the Chromebook, all of a sudden it was around $10 cheaper than what I paid for it. Then the next day it was back to around what I paid for it.If you are OK with a Chromebook that will receive OS updates for only 3 more years, then by all means purchase this one. New Chromebooks with 2 in 1 screens are not cheap. The one I received really is in great condition. Maybe I’ll just buy a used one every 3 years.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love my laptop - with a longer battery and less finicky mouse, this would be a perfect machine!
reviewText: Before buying this laptop, I first purchased an HP flip screen laptop from Target. To say I was disappointed was an understatement. I knew there had to be something better on the market!I tried my luck on this laptop and immediately fell in love. While the prices were similar, the level of quality felt incomparable. Visuals on the screen are decent quality, and the touch screen is perfect. It's compatible with multiple styluses and works beautifully for drawing and sketching.The keyboard is not back-lit, but the keys are decent enough for the price point. I use a Macbook Pro for work, and you should not expect this machine to act like that type of workhorse. Even just after sleeping for a day or two with programs running this little guy requires a restart. However, I feel perfectly satisfied with the product I received for this price point.There are only two opportunities with this laptop:* Battery Life - while at first this easily went a full week without requiring a charge, it's now beginning to need one every 4-5 days. I'm a little leery that it's losing power after about six weeks of solid use - but since I only use it at home, it's rarely an issue.* Built-in mouse - this mouse is kind of crappy. I use a trackpad for my job every day and find this unit incredibly finicky. It leaps, it skips, it jumps - it is not steady and takes me longer to click to where I'm going as a result. I largely use my laptop on my couch, but if I were working or studying I'd definitely recommend an external mouse.That said - for this price point, you're not going to get perfection. What you ARE going to get is a VERY decent computer that can surf the web, type emails, novels, what have you, and offer a very solid solution for drawing when you want to mix things up a bit.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars College ready
reviewText: I love this laptop. For 200 this is a steal, I really didn't even know it was touch screen until a month later and it made me love it even more. The touch screen only uses your actual fingers and not a digital pen, this is not a tablet. I use it as an additional laptop to my main one. Basically, I use this laptop for school going from class to class because A) its light, B) If it gets stolen it was only 200 c) The specs are good for its price. I am a junior physics major who uses it for coding, school work, and circuitry. The only downside is that you would need to change the battery(Dont have to change it at first, still works with what was given but you would get more life if changed). But really compared to the other options this I found was the best after weeks of research for a cheap laptop. The battery can last up to around 2 hrs 20 min Id say if put on lowest performance. It works fine if you have it connected to its charger(Usb C), which most classes have. Good space if you only use it for school work, Have not tried gaming on it other than chess.com mainly because I have a better pc for that. Would highly recommend it if you are on a budget. Runs windows also.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good purchase if you know what you are buying for!
reviewText: This laptop works well so far. Just docking off half a point for the absence of internal battery as mentioned by other reviews.I bought this laptop to give away to someone i know. Basically, decided on this laptop considering the upgradeability factor and also from experience of using this model as my work machine.The packging was good and the refurbished information came with it as well. The windows activation was a breeze. The front lid of the machine came with a matte sticker finish to possibly hide any previous usage blemishes.I've done a couple upgrades so far. The laptop came with a 256GB SSD albeit a 2.5 inch SATA model. I've upgraded this to a SK Hynix P31 Gold 1TB NVME. I had to buy a 2.5 inch SATA to NVME bay to accomplish this.I've also updated the Wifi controller. It came with a 8265NGW chip. I've upgraded this to Intel AX210NGW. This will support Wifi 6/6E and Bluetooth 5.2/5.3. I've tested this and noticed definite speed increase on the wifi connection. I needed to download the Intel drivers for Bluetooth and Wifi beforehand and install the drivers after installing the new chip. If you are familiar with changing M2 type drives it will be a similar process along with plugging in some antenna connections.Finally, recommend downloading Lenovo Vantage from Microsoft app store and doing all the necessary system updates along with updating the Thunderbolt 3 firmware as T480 is known to have issues with Thunderbolt 3 with old firmware.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Faulty Thinkpad T480 from Microbeeglobal: Don’t Waste Your Money
reviewText: I purchased a refurbished Thinkpad T480 from Microbeeglobal on Amazon, but unfortunately, the device was faulty and stopped working after only a few months of real use (less than 6 months). The charging port + Thunderbolt port were both dead (buying a new one plus motherboard soldering is not a DIY fix). I would not recommend buying from this seller, as my experience was less than satisfactory. Upon receiving my device, it looked clean with no scratches, but some parts and folds had dust. The internal (main) battery was not reliable since day one, but the extended one worked fine (48WH one). When I contacted the support team, they confirmed that it was a motherboard issue and that it was hard to fix by myself. I am past Amazon’s 90-day return window, and the seller’s support team suggested returning or replacing the device but stopped answering afterwards. Although the support team was friendly, it was difficult to get my message through, and some of the emails had Chinese words. I later found out that the team works from UAE

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good things come in small, refurbished packages
reviewText: This is hands-down the best laptop I have ever owned!! My boyfriend has a model a few years older than this one and it always works beautifully for him, so I decided to get one for myself after much contemplation and research. I have had this laptop for over a month and I use it heavily on a near-daily basis for taking notes, reading online textbooks, web browsing, writing papers, etc. I don't play video games and I don't have a lot of pictures or music I store on my hard drive, so this is perfect for me. I would highly recommend this computer to those in school and/or those who mainly use their laptops for web browsing and Microsoft Office uses. The smaller screen doesn't bother me at all, but some folks might have an issue with it - just something to be aware of if you're looking for/needing something with a larger screen.The touchscreen works beautifully. It boots up quickly every time I open it, and even with the 4GB of RAM preinstalled, it can handle all of my tabs and programs open (I plan to expand it to 8GB soon). The only "complaint" I have is its battery life. It's decent, much better than that of the ASUS I had before, but I bought this computer refurbished, so maybe in a year or so I'll replace the battery. Still, for the low price and all of the features, durability, convenience, and reliability, this is one hell of a deal! I am a very happy customer! Lenovo is the only brand I will ever buy!!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I think I'm going to like this, though the screen is small. Not their fault.
reviewText: I chose the Lenovo Thinkplad Yoga because of the reviews, mainly, and because of the Lenovo name. I like the idea of a solid state drive. This is a refurbished unit but it looks brand new. Very nice! Arrived quickly and was packaged really well.The battery life, as noted in the reviews, is short, but I keep mine plugged in most of the time when I'm at home, anyway.I want to turn off the touchpad but it looks like it's unnecessarily complicated. My old laptop had a key for it, but this one requires many steps.Only two usb ports but it says they're both 3.0, so that's good.The FN button is where the Ctrl button normally is, so I keep hitting the wrong button. I suppose I'll get used to that.This is more like a notebook than a laptop, though it works the same, which is what I want, but with only 128 gb I'm already out of room. I hadn't counted on that. Looks like I'll be using the cloud or a flash drive now, and will have to figure out which is best for me. I'm used to having tons of room on a laptop so this will take some getting used to, too.It's heavier than I expected, considering there is no hard drive and no disk player.I've only had it for a few days, so if I find anything else I'll come back and update.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, affordable, small laptop for daily use. NO BACKLIT KEYS
reviewText: This met my expectations for the price. I can use it for my daily writing and internet use, it's not gigantic so I can fit it in a smaller bag, and it has a very responsive touchscreen (honestly better quality than I expected for the price). It acts as a 2-1 tablet/computer, while having a much sturdier clamshell hinge than a typical tablet with a keyboard attached. It is much more comfortable to type with in my lap, and feels less delicate (less easily broken). The battery life is pretty standard and no complaints (around 5 hours).Some downsides that were not easily noticeable from viewing it online:- The 11 inch size refers to the viewing portion of the screen, which has a large border, so the actual laptop is more like 13 inches. This was mildly disappointing because I really wanted it to be as small as possible to fit in my day bag. (But it's still fairly small.)- There are no backlit keys on the keyboard.- It is a bit heavy for its size (but not unmanageable).The refurbish job was pretty good. The only issue was the trackpad seemed a little too clacky (maybe loose), but it worked perfectly.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Buyers **BEWARE**
reviewText: This is my third yoga 11e. All three are refurbished. So, the minor scratches and blemishes are understood. Here are the things that I have issues with on this last Yoga 11e1. It states Windows 10, but it has Windows 11. Usually, I would say this would be a plus. But the Yoga 11e doesn't have the possessor or RAM to have Windows 11. The system is so slow, and the response hurts when trying to open an app or even start up.2. Sound card - 5 minutes into the start of me using this laptop/tablet, the sound goes wonky and is in slow motion sound and sounds like a robot. It's not acceptable for out of the box.3. The hinge and mismatch screws. Ok, I know this is wear and tear. But Amazon has this in excellent condition. These items should have been replaced.4. There is no tablet mode. I'm unsure if this is a Win11 thing, but you have a tablet mode on the Action Center. I use this laptop/tablet to watch streams, so I turned the keyboard over so it would stand up to watch.4.5 Well, it kind of goes with the above. When you have it in the inverted position, the keyboard is still active, and keys are being pushed. I can’t type anything without holding the machine up.Things I enjoy1. Cheap2. Is a laptop and tablet3. Touch screen4. It does the job for what I need it to do.Yes, I'm returning this. I hope to resolve the issues above with the next one. Wish me luck. I hope this helps you. Thanks for reading.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Listing kept me in the Dark
reviewText: The Chromebook came as advertised with the exception that it does not have a backlit keyboard as it was listed as having. It is also completely out of it's warranty period, which was not mentioned. Overall the Chromebook is excellent. It is a little larger and heavier than I expected, but not so much that it is going to be a problem. The picture quality is excellent. As with all Chromebook's the audio quality is good, but the volume is very low. This is compounded by the speakers being on the bottom (do the people who designed this have a different way of holding a laptop where speakers on the bottom is a good listening position?) Downloading any volume boosting extension will solve the volume problem. It has a large keyboard and touch pad, and the touchscreen works well. It charges relatively quickly and the battery seems to last. I have noticed that with 100% battery, when you unplug the charger, there is a noticeable dimming of the screen, which I will have to look into. I've emailed the seller and I am waiting to hear back about the backlit keyboard and warranty. I am withholding 1 star for not having a backlit keyboard 1 for not mentioning it being out of warranty and 1 waiting to see how this is handled. I will update the rating and comments as soon as the dust settles.Update. I had a response in under 30 minutes. They apologized for the confusion and gave me the options to either return it for a full refund or they would send me $20. I took the $20 which will buy me a keyboard light. Promt, polite and offered a solution acceptable to us both. Great customer service. Changed the rating to 4 stars.I have a defacto 30 day warranty, in the return window. Lenovo has a 2 year, in home, service in 24 hours warranty I can purchase, that also covers the screen and accidental damage (if I drop it and crack the screen I'm covered) for $122.45 (plus a warranty reinstatement fee if $22). Even with a bogus reinstatement fee its a good deal. The seller, Amazon and Lenovo customer service all did a good job on this one. 2 thumbs up! 👍👍

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I like the machine - not the case.
reviewText: I needed a new Chromebook when my old one's updates expired and it started acting weird. I chose this one because the price, the reviews, the specs, and the expiration date of updates met or exceeded my minimum qualifications.PROS: I am pleased so far with almost all aspects of the machine. I still have to do a little fine-tuning with the settings but overall, I am pleased.CONS: 1. Although I was supposed to get a power cord, there was not one in the box. This was not an issue since I could use the one from my old CB.2. I hate the case. My old CB had a textured plastic case and was very easy to grip and stayed put. I have to tightly grip this smooth metal case when lifting it which creates pain in my hand. It slips around on my lap when I use it. I have to grip the corner. I finally resorted to using a small bathmat upside down to help with the stability.Bottom line: I like the machine but hate the smooth metal case.Added note: FYI: This model is supported through June 2025. When the support for my previous Chromebook ended, I planned to continue using it while I shopped for a replacement. However, the device was pretty much unusable after that date - so much garbage, pop-ups, etc. started showing up on my screen. So take that into consideration when buying this model.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The camera doesn't work on my Chromebook update
reviewText: I like a Chromebook, especially when the camera works. I found Lenovo support online and scheduled an appointment for them to call me. They called the exact time I had scheduled. The technician was knowledgeable and professional. I found out there is a small switch at the top of the screen that covers the camera. I would highly recommend a Lenovo Chromebook. I have had mine a week and will add additional information if any problems arise.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on February 7, 2020
reviewTitle: Excellent hardware
reviewText: This Lenovo is my first Chromebook but umpteenth Lenovo laptop. First, I held my breath and clicked Used - Very Good from Amazon Warehouse Deals to save almost $100. Small cosmetic imperfections on sides of the item. Well, I can't see any imperfections anywhere. Couldn't tell the difference between this and a brand new machine. The laptop looks great, the large screen is awesome, the operation is snappy with the I3, no performance issues with only 4 GB RAM, I am very pleased with this machine, it fully meets my Lenovo build expectations.One thing that surprised me but shouldn't is that this machine is way heavier than our Lenovo X1 Carbon gen 4. 2.7 lbs vs 4.3 lbs. But, having the larger screen is so great and its a touch screen to boot.It is Chrome OS that causes the loss of one star. It took me 2 days to configure this machine and I've been building PCs since the late 90's. The problem I had is probably not one that most people will have. I subscribe to G Suite for Business and I guess that when it comes to Chromebooks, the Suite administration sticks its tentacles in there whether you want it or not.One major issue was that Google Play was disabled in my Chromebook (a nonstarter) with a message that said "this is managed by your administrator". I'm the administrator and I did not disable Google Play for any of my devices. Turns out G Suite disables Google Play by default. So just go into G Suite and enable Google Play. Not so fast, navigating G Suite is a nightmare, completely non-intuitive, at least for me. Ultimately after a day of Google searches and fruitlessly trying all kinds of switches in G Suite, a Google support person set me straight. All was fine after speaking with him.The next challenge was Microsoft Office integration. I also subscribe to Office 365. Eat another day, the MS apps would not let me sign-in with my account. Call to Microsoft support fixed that. Then the next challenge was passing files between OneDrive and Google Drive. Installing File System for Windows was the answer. Finally, I had Chrome OS configured the way I needed it to be. In 2020, it should not be this hard to get your new laptop up and running.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing!
reviewText: I've only had it for 3 days now but I love everything about it so far!First of all the appearance: I love the color; it's a metallic pink that almost looks silver, but the keyboard's pink is much more noticeably pink. The letters on the keyboard itself are large and easy to read. There were a few minor scratches on the outside of mine but the inside is pristine.Moving on to sound: The keys are relatively quiet when you type on them, but the space bar is a bit too loud in my opinion. I've only used it for roughly four hours so far but I haven't heard any loud air vents coming from it.One side note I'd like to mention real quick though is that when I was setting everything up, it was really pushing me to sign up for a bunch of Microsoft related products which I found a little annoying. I prefer using Google for browsing which is completely free whereas the Microsoft stuff would have charged me after one year of usage(I believe it was a year).And finally performance: Like practically every other laptop, this one takes a minute or two to really start working properly when you initially turn it on. I've only really used it for typing so I haven't really dived into browsing the web, but I can confidently say that the keys are immediately responsive when I type anything out. I haven't had any issues with it running slow as of yet.The battery life is very good. I had it on the highest brightness while using it outside for a few hours and it only dropped to 88% where it was originally charged to 100.One final thing I'd like to mention is that I absolutely love the screen! I bought this to work on my novel outside and while I always try to work in the shade, the sun can be a little pesky, however the screen is mostly opaque and has little to no reflection - making it the perfect laptop to use outside!Anyway, if this laptop is still available to order, I highly recommend it if you plan on using it for work!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Check your printer
reviewText: I love my little Chromebook!! I've had one before and it got old and they quit doing updates on it, so I had to get a newer version. So be careful to check the useful life of your Chromebook when you decide to get one. When they stop automatically downloading software updates it's only good for another year and a half or so before you slowly start losing function. This model will receive updates through 2030 so I'm happy with that. Only problem I have with the concept of Chromebooks is that it's not compatible with my printer. I guess there must be a special " chrome printer" out there somewhere? I'm making due by using my phone to print off anything saved in my Google drive account. The most wonderful thing about Chromebooks is that I don't ever need to worry about viruses or antiviral software!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for kids school Chromebook
reviewText: The Lenovo Chromebook is an outstanding choice for families, particularly for kids, offering great value for its price. Its lightweight design and durable build make it perfect for younger users, while the Chrome OS provides a user-friendly and secure platform for both education and entertainment.The battery life is impressive, lasting up to 10 hours, which is ideal for long school days or extended use at home. The system boots up quickly, and with access to Google Play, kids can easily download educational apps, games, and productivity tools. Despite being budget-friendly, it doesn’t skimp on performance, handling multitasking and streaming with ease.For parents concerned about safety, the Lenovo Chromebook includes built-in virus protection and automatic updates, ensuring that kids can browse and use apps without worrying about malware or security issues. The keyboard is comfortable for typing, which is great for homework assignments or online classes.Overall, the Lenovo Chromebook is a highly affordable, reliable, and kid-friendly option that provides an excellent balance of functionality and durability at a great price point. Highly recommended for families looking for a dependable device for their children!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Definitely not "like new" as described, but functional and will do in a pinch
reviewText: ***Update: I amended this review from three stars to one star, because a couple of weeks after I posted this initial review, my computer simply stopped working. It will turn on, but I get a plain black screen. With all the other issues I was having, I simply decided this was not worth the hassle and returned it. I will also note that I didn't mention it in my initial review, but this whole process also included another purchase of the same item that was for some reason flagged as undeliverable during shipping, so I never received that one. It's just become a massive headache that's already worth more than $80 in my time and energy, so I opted to simply return the computer.The return process was easy at least, but I will not be buying refurbished electronics on Amazon again.I'm leaving my original review below for posterity.***I bought this computer advertised in "like new" condition for around $75. I wasn't expecting miracles, but there are a couple things I have an issue with enough to give a 3 star review. They're not a big enough deal to request a refund (again, $75 computer here...I feel like going through the process of requesting a return/replacement is more of hassle), but not great. If this had been advertised for its actual condition, I still might have bought it, but I'd be giving it a much better rating.Biggest one is that in my "like new" computer, the track pad is wonky. It sometimes catches clicked down in a way I can feel if I click too far to the bottom left, and I have yet to be able to successfully highlight anything because the drag is weird. Neither of these are a huge deal for the way I plan to use this computer (especially because the touch screen does work fine so worst case I just highlight by touch), but it's less than I expected based on the listing.The other is that my computer arrived dirty, which I wasn't surprised by as other reviewers have mentioned it, but it was kind of disappointing. I don't think it was anything particularly gross, but there was a goopy smear on one of the device's silver-colored hinges that was rather off-putting, along with a spray of dried droplets on the screen. Probably just grease or oil and the residue of cleaner, but let's just say I cleaned the whole thing thoroughly before I used it.Overall, though, I just needed a really cheap computer to get me through a couple weeks, and this fits the bill. It runs fine other than the trackpad issue, comes with a decent charger, set up easily, all that good stuff. Just, you know, be aware that you're definitely getting what you're paying for!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's a value at a bargain price.
reviewText: Just as stated in the header and as many have rated it is bargain for a reason. I purchase one as a small personal device as i have my phone and pc the second one was for my child as a learning device and a first introductory lap top/tablet as he is 5 years old and is in home-school program. The price is a steal if you are looking on the cheap side. But make sure you dont get upset when it may come with defects.Pros: Value, 2-in-1, compact.Cons: No cap button and defects vary.As i stated I bought two as shown in the pics; the first one I bought seemed to be brand new never touch; no problems, so i decided to get a second to appease my child as he was immediately drawn to it and i figured it would be a great tool for his schooling. some of the best features from Google is the supervision so i can monitor what my child is doing limiting how much time he is using it for and so on. Sorry if this is a run on. the only fustrating thing is the No Cap button as u are forced to shift + what ever letter ur trying to capitalize in replace is the quick button to google search which i find annoying retraining the muscle memory of my fingers.Another thing is that some time it will not power on and you have to google why and find out why there is a refresh button. They also provided two different charge cord DO NOT SWAP! Other wise it will crash; any way hope this help in deciding if it is worth the buy. iMO it is as I wanted something not expensive does the basics and is both a lap/ tablet.**** UPDATE ****in order to stop with the google search button you can change the keyboard layout or its control functions in Setting > Devices > Keyboard> Custom KeyBoard Keys... It took me almost 1month to figure it out. Hope this help some one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars If i could give 0 stars, I would
reviewText: When it arrived, I thought by the paperwork provided and reviews that the laptop would be in great condition working. I wasn’t using it so much in the first month or so after receiving it, but once I wanted to start using it for work and school, I noticed the battery would not stay charged for longer than 5–10 minutes unless constantly plugged into the charger. Some applications were also lagging when I tried operating. I waited some time but then when the problem became really persistent especially since I needed to use a laptop on daily basis for my job and school, I started a request for the seller to help me with the issue. I get a response that it is over the 90 day refund/replacement time frame (it was 5 days over when I put the request in) and that basically they can’t help me. I started contacting Amazon and multiple representatives started an A-Z claim, even though it was past the 90 days, I was told that I would be helped with the issue since the seller was not responsive. After a month of calling customer service, and being told that they understand my frustration and my issue would be fixed (I would get a return/refund), I’m now being told that Amazon can’t help me either. I am still currently trying to get my issue resolved with Amazon, but I would save your time and money and not buy from this seller. Almost $400 down the drain for a laptop that doesn’t function how a refurbished laptop should (I didn’t even get to talking about the cosmetic damages sticker cover up). I would strongly recommend saving up for a brand new laptop somewhere else if you are able to, because this will cause you issues (not far) down the line.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Lenovo L14 (Refurbished)
reviewText: Although it says many specs, its not exactly what I expected. The laptop needed to be heavily updated, including updating to Windows 11, some required Lenovo updates, along with updating some of the AMD drivers.However, regardless of that, the screen looks really good and the speed seems quite decent as well. The touch screen works pretty well.On the exterior, there are a few scratches around the bottom of it, but I think that is standard for used laptop like this. It is otherwise clean.Battery life is pretty great and tight. Can remain steady for a 4-6 hours doing light tasks.In summary, the quality is incredible for the price. The build is strong and as long as you know how to use any other Windows computer, this one should be easy to use as well. Despite it being refurbished and besides a few minor issues mentioned earlier, its as good as new.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Arrived promptly, excellent quality, will purchase again.
reviewText: Kids loved the laptop, excellent quality, easy set up, arrived in timely fashion!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Immaculate Refurbished Condition - Thinkpad Quality
reviewText: The Thinkpad I received was in functionally perfect condition. The body of the laptop had no scratches whatosever, the display had no scratches or defects like dead pixels, and the keyboard felt brand new with keycaps that were definitely unused and free of plastic wear or fingerprinting.The Ryzen 5 Pro 5675U benches nearly as well as an i7-8700K overclocked to 4.9 GHz in my testing, making this one heck of workhorse for the price. Gaming was also surprisingly good despite no dedicated graphics after I installed 32gb of RAM for an additional $40, then changed the VRAM in BIOS to 4GB.Genshin Impact ran at 1080p, 0.8 render scale, and medium settings with a comfortable 30 FPS. I was even able to play Armored Core 6 at 720p low to medium settings with a steady 30 FPS. Classic games and indies will be zero problem, as I've been playing Guild Wars on its highest settings at 1080p 120-200 FPS in most areas.The value here is incredible. You get a fairly powerful CPU for the form factor and price, and even some casual gaming capability, all for $320. I would suggest a RAM upgrade to 32GB, however, because the integrated Radeon graphics will dedicate some amount of the system RAM for itself. That brings the total to $360 in my case, which is still an incredible value for the system you're getting here.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Streaming, Bad for Steam
reviewText: At $190, this laptop was a total steal. The 2k screen looks great, backlit keyboard is nice, and it charges 50% per hour give or take. I have not used it heavily, but expect the battery should last around 10 hours under moderate use, more than enough for my needs. Setting it up was a cinch, by scanning a QR code with my phone. It boots in <5s, and runs fast for browsing/streaming. I bought a USB C hub with HDMI to run an external monitor, which works fine. Steaming Call of Duty Black Ops 6 via Steam also tested out ok. While Amazon says this is renewed, there's no sign of wear or use, it looks brand new.I was surprised I could actually install Steam on this, via browser (NOT the Google Play store's version). Rocket League runs locally, but "run" is a generous word when its <20fps at lowest settings. Terraria works fine, but I would not say this PC is capable to play local games. With those two games installed, I have about 40GB left of free space, it started with about 75GB free. This laptop is better served for browsing the internet, Google Docs, and streaming videos/games, but that's exactly what I was looking for. No complaints.

reviewText: I purchased this unit and really enjoyed it. Even though it was bigger than i normally use, i was going to keep it anyway but unfortunately relentless wifi issues made me return it. Constant disconnects from anything requiring a reliable connection. Amazon luna constantly kicked me out, geforce now and xcloud both had constant disconnects. I couldnt get through a 20 minute zoom meeting without a dozen reconnects. I have other devices, including chromebooks that dont have any issues with my internet. Being a chromebook means i cant swap for another wifi chip leaving me to return. Perhaps it was only my unit but truly unfortunate.

I usually just buy Asus, and still have a decent flip with a good 15 inch screen, but that machine is shutting down randomly -- I should probably wipe with a factory reset but that's a chore.

Googled reviews on some I narrowed down to 3 and compared everything to prices. This computer was at my price point and provided the necessary amount of everything I needed for school and work. The battery life is amazing...but it's also still new, it immediately loads and connects, Internet browsing is seamless, it's light weight and easy to carry around. The screen size isn't too big or too small, watching movies and videos with no issues. I love this computer and am so glad I purchased it. Well worth the money!The only two issues I would change but not anything I'd send back and cry about are the volume is a bit low and the charging connection. I'm not a fan of the tiny little connector as my clumsy a$$ would probably bend it and ruin it. But otherwise now I'm just super vigilant to it and have adapted to being more cautious around it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Broken hinge turned a decent laptop into useless junk
reviewText: The right hinge on our Lenovo started pulling up on the casing, which in a matter of weeks led to the screen breaking completely. All of this was bad, but since it happened after we'd only had it for six months, we should still be good, right? The Lenovo manufacture warranty covers hardware failure and defects during the first year, so surely this would count?After more than an hour on the phone with Lenovo tech support, unfortunately, the answer was essentially, "nah, we're good, take care of it yourself." Why, you might ask, would a manufacturer warranty not cover an issue with the hinge of the laptop destroying the laptop, after only extremely light use? The guy on the phone told me, "Hardware doesn't count the outside of the laptop. We mean hardware like the motherboard. Only the INSIDE of the laptop is covered."So, buyer beware. Personally I'll never buy another Lenovo product again. And I'll certainly never waste any time thinking their manufactures warranty is worth a damn.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect So Far
reviewText: I've never purchased a refurbished computer before, so I wasn't entirely sure what sort of condition it would come in. I have to say I'm pleasantly surprised and satisfied. As an edition to my review, I must report that the only thing I'm not entirely happy about is that the battery life is short. I can write without a power connection for perhaps three hours. Besides that, the keyboard is clean and feels nice. It's a great layout, and all in all it's almost like having a new laptop, but at a great price. The seller promised to fix anything I wasn't happy about, and you can't get better than that. It seems to be fast and fully functional. I have the basic apps I was hoping for, so I don't have to go searching for them. The computer has a mic and a camera. I'm very pleased with the purchase.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Product is defective. No response from vendor. Has dead internal battery and dead USB-C port.
reviewText: Several show stoppers here...On the Amazon description page, the product manufacture date was listed as 2023. When received, the DELL manufacture date stamped on the laptop is 2017. Shipping was slow but packaging was good. Just laptop and power supply in box in bubble wrap. Aside from manufacture date, laptop specs were as advertised, HOWEVER the show stopper are; The internal battery is completely dead and will not hold a charge. The DELL diagnostics show that a test run in 2022 warned of a insufficient powered battery. My tests show the batter completely dead and the BIOS doesn't even recognize it. Also, the USB-C port with which I intended to connect to my DELL docking station was also dead. The docking station works perfectly with my 2-year old Dell Latitude. When plugged-in via the USB-C port, the laptop speakers squeal and the system locks up. I've sent an email through Amazon marketplace, an email directly to the company, and an email through their website customer assistance page. No answer.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars my 3rd Dell Latitude
reviewText: I've had it only a few days, but so far I'm very pleased. It came in A+ condition, WAY ahead of time, just like new, the diagnostics (F12 at bootup) are good, and it is a lively, very capable unit with an excellent display (at the very top of my gotta-be's was a matte screen, I use it in a very bright environment, and it meets that requirement perfectly). My only disappointment is that it doesn't have separate volume/mute buttons (it has Fn +/- volume, not nearly as handy, I guess I'll get used to it). One surprise: I assumed that there wouldn't be any damage insurance available, so beforehand I found a deal from Progressive, $200+ for 3 years, $50 deductible. OK I thought, not great but I'll buy it after getting the laptop. When I checked out, they offered 4-yr, no deductible insurance for about $150. That's a great deal for a 3 yr old laptop, surprised they don't trumpet it in the description.An update after 3 days: I found a few problems with the software that they should have caught before shipping. I got in touch with them and they immediately sent me a UPS return label for a replacement, but that would take over a week before I get one back with a mirror image of this one, which it set up exactly to my specs. Not an appealing idea. Fortunately it still has a warranty so got in touch with Dell. After getting cut off twice, the 3rd agent did a good job fixing it. So a caveat: if you get this, get someone who knows IT to check it out (I'm a little smarter than the average IT bear, so at least I knew where to look for problems). Unfortunately then I'm downgrading my rating to 4 stars.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing value for the money
reviewText: After reading the description i was unclear on what the laptop specs were actually going to be, so I rolled the dice. It turned out pretty well. Mine has the 7600 variant cpu, not the 6600 variant cpu. There is no touchscreen, but I don't normally use that anyway so it's not a real loss. I saw both 2560x1440 and 1920x1080 listed as max resolutions, well this one is 1080p. The SSD is an M2 NVME, pretty nice really. These are not new laptops but they are fast enough for my needs, I am very pleased with it.I cannot speak to how great the included Windows 10 Pro install is, because I blew it away immediately and installed Debian GNU/Linux instead. This product line is certified by Dell to run Ubuntu but that also means that any Debian-based distribution should run as well with minimal headaches. YMMV, but I was up and running in about 3 hours from the time I received it, most of that time was waiting around for various installers to finish or for my files to sync over the network.This is an obvious refurb. Prepare yourself for that. The case is slightly shopworn in spots, none so much to actually bother me. My biggest complaint is that it still smells like the previous user's perfume, and it grates on me, so I will working to find a fix for that.It came packed well, or least well enough as is necessary in 2024. Unlike the days of mechanical drives, SSDs can take a beating so the packing in the box is sufficient.All in all I am very pleased, though. It's in good enough condition it may as well be new, and even if it only lasts for a couple of years it will still be a great value.

reviewText: This is a review of a spin 513 with snapdragon processor, part # R841T-S4ZG. In my opinion this chromebook is an excellent value at the price I paid, which was $247. It has a bright display, backlit keyboard, and a good touchpad. Sound is adequate. It has a nice look and feel, and it's lightweight - 2.5 lb on my digital kitchen scale. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Honest Review
reviewText: I think this is the first review I have ever done lol So I bought this laptop after my Levono Yoga C90 finally went out. Going from a state of the art Laptop at the time (2018) and with an overall price tag of $1400.00, I could not see myself going back to anything else. (It had a dolby atmos soundbar built in lol) It had everything and more than I needed. And when I decided to buy something I could take on the go and do my day to day. I came about this laptop on Amazon. I needed something that would able to do what I mostly do on my laptop. Word processing and watching YouTube and the other streaming services I cant live without lol and check into other social media if I felt like it. I spent two days doing research, and looking at YouTube videos and reviews of this laptop. When I finally got it home, I was surprised how thin and light it was. I am a musician and I was surprised how clear and how loud the sound would get. Screen was very clear and bright. The one thing I had to get used to, is the operating system. I have used Windows for 30 plus years. I was surprised how easy it was to learn Chrome OS. There are MANY features I miss from Windows. But for what I need it to do its holding up . Overall for this price I am happy. NOTE: I have seen some reviewers say there is not a back lit keyboard. THERE IS ONE. I would NOT of bought this laptop if there was not one. Thats the first thing I look for. This laptop is like an electric hybrid, light simple to use and will get the job done. IF you are looking for a juiced up race car with all the bells and whistles, then this is not the right laptop for you. But if you wannt something affordable and does all the above, then this might be for you

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars UPDATED
reviewText: Keyboard is flimsy and falling apart already. SLOW after required updates. Backlight on keyboard and speakers no longer work unless plugged in. USB port just died. Barely had 4 months and ready to scrap. Save yourself the trouble, there's a reason it's the cheapest in the category....Pros: responsive touch screen, backlit keyboard, lightweight, portable, excellent battery life, inexpensive.Cons: not as quick as it could be (but for the price plenty fast), screen glare in light, top shell is aluminum but bottom shell is plastic. The model is from 2021, the one I got was manufactured May 2021.I primarily use this for travel and laying in bed, for those purposes it works great. Don't expect this to hold up to a more powerful laptop, but for browsing or for things like Netflix and YouTube, it's great.

I reached out to Amazon support to swap it out for the correct model with backlit keyboard and they just sent me the exact same model back without the backlit keyboard. Very frustrating, but other than that, I am very pleased with it. Although I'd prefer a backlit keyboard, my time is way too valuable to keep playing the send it back and receive the same laptop, game.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent for Basic Use, But Lacks Speed
reviewText: I purchased this HP Chromebook 14" G5 hoping for a simple and lightweight laptop to handle basic tasks like browsing the web, checking emails, and streaming videos. While it performs well for those tasks, I was disappointed with its speed. The Intel Celeron N3350 processor is simply not powerful enough for multitasking or more demanding applications. Unfortunately, this limitation wasn’t clearly stated in the product description, which could mislead potential buyers looking for a faster device.That being said, there are some positives worth mentioning. The Chromebook’s design is sleek and lightweight, making it easy to carry around. The 14-inch screen is bright and offers good resolution for watching videos, and the keyboard is comfortable for typing. Additionally, the device arrived in excellent condition, and for a renewed product, it looks brand new.If you’re looking for a budget-friendly laptop for very basic use, this could work for you. However, if speed and performance are important, I’d recommend exploring other options.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent, just like new
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I’ve been using for one month already, and wanted to wait o do a fair review.That was one of my greatest experience buying refurbished. The computer came as new, no scratches, screen quality amazing, really easy to setup with my iCloud account, connecting to all my apps, battery life is not like forever but works great.Size and weight are perfect to carry anywhere so you can work outdoors or in a coffee shop. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it ❤️
reviewText: Looks and work like brand new, which did not surprised me because a few years ago , I got a renewed MacBook Pro from Amazon and it was the same: it arrived like new and is still working perfectly. Of course, you have treat it gently and keep up with any maintenance (both physical and software-related) This MacBook Air was a gift for my father. It came like brand new, free of any cosmetic damage like scratches and scuffs. Nothing!After examining the physical appearance we made sure we’re getting the right specifications, too. To see basic information about the Mac, choose Apple menu > About This Mac. In this case, this info was just as described.The battery is in great condition too and it last for so many hours, I don’t know exactly how many because I never let the battery to run out of power. Also We tested all ports:* Two USB ports* 1 Thunderbolt port* 1 MagSafe power port* 1 SDXC card slotAll five ports are working perfectly., as well as the 3.5 mm headphone jack.The Stereo speaker and the microphones are working fine too. The Full-size backlit keyboard is fantastic The backlit is sooo bright, but we know to pessF5 to lower keyboard brightness and F6 to raise it. That’s so simple.The MacBook came with “Catalina version 10.15.6” and it was asking to update to “ Monterrey’ , which at first we were very hesitant to do because the laptop ran so smoothly just as it came and didn’t want to ruin it. We consulted by phone the local computer shop and they said It's best for your computer to be on the latest software update. It fixes bugs, gives some new features, but most importantly, they have tons of security fixes. So we did it and now the laptop is running just as fine as it came, just with better features.All in all we are very happy with this purchase!!! Thanks Amazon for offering these amazing renewed laptops and many, many thanks to the vendor!!!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A mess
reviewText: I ordered one and the entire two bottom rows of keys stuck, would click like there was sand under the keyboard, or wouldn’t pop back up so my sentence looked like this“Mmmmmmmmy nnnnew laptop Is unnnnnnnnusabbble”So I reached out to Amazon support who processed a replacement. Unfortunately the replacement was also unusable because the charging port would not hold the charger in it. So unless I wanted to sit there and hold the charger for 2 hours to charge it I had to return that one too. So I reached out to support again and processed that return.I ordered a third one hoping the third time would be the charm but alas, it was not. This one has a battery life of about 18 minutes from full charge until it’s dead. I understand these are refurbished but I have some major concerns about quality control at this point as it doesn’t seem like random bad luck that I’d get 3 laptops with major problems.Also adding that these are listed in excellent condition however there are also significant cosmetic issues as well. Scratches, deep dents, bent corners. Not something I’d look at and say “yeah this is in excellent condition”. I hope the seller takes more care in refurbishing these in the future because it feels like they are just out here taking in a computer, restoring it to factory settings and listing it for sale. No way they could do even a cursory check of these and not notice 20 sticky keys or the inability to charge a computer.This process has taken me about 3 weeks from placing my first order and has been a headache all around. I wouldn’t recommend these unless you are fully aware that you’ll need to dedicate time and money to making the computer you receive able to be used.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Value for money
reviewText: I recently bought a renewed 2017 Apple MacBook Air with a 1.8GHz Intel Core i5 processor, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB SSD storage, and it’s been a pretty decent product. For everyday tasks like browsing, streaming, and using apps, it runs smoothly. The 128GB storage is a bit small if you have a lot of files, but the fast SSD helps with quick boot times and file access. The build quality is great, as you’d expect from Apple, with a sturdy aluminum body and a bright 13-inch screen. The keyboard is comfortable to type on, and the trackpad is responsive. The battery life is another great feature, lasting a long time on a single charge.As a renewed model, this MacBook Air is a great deal. It’s a cost-effective way to get a reliable Apple laptop without spending a fortune. It’s not the most powerful laptop out there, but for general use and for what I’m using it for on the day to day, it’s enough. Additionally, the slim and lightweight design makes it easy to carry around. If you don’t need a ton of storage, this 2017 MacBook Air is a solid choice that’s easily portable with good performance and decent battery life. My only wish is that the screen quality was a little better. Overall, it’s a good laptop.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful, ultra portable notebook with one flaw.
reviewText: Powerful, ultra portable notebook with one flaw.Pros:- Powerful processor- The speakers are surprisingly good. Make sure to go into the HP Audio Control app and enable the equalizer and balance out the base so it doesn't sound tinny.- Integrated ATI video performs well even in mid range 3D video games.- The laptop arrived in mint condition and well packaged. Looks brand new. Koodos to the seller.- Came with Windows 10 Pro and you can upgrade to Windows 11 for free.- Fast solid state drive.- Super light weight and portable.- Nice long power cord (about 6 feet long)Cons:- The software for controlling the video card from ATI is confusing for novices.- The display generally looks great, but it can't reproduces red colors well at all. You will mostly not notice this unless you need color matching. Adjusting the ATI settings to compensate is impossible since it is a screen quality issue.- The screen does not get bright enough to use outside in sunlight.Overall, this is a great laptop at a super price. Highly recommend as long as you don't need perfect color representation.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The one I got was never used
reviewText: On the plus side, very well packaged. I dont think it was ever used, there is not a mark on it and the feet are not even scuffed. Window opened with "Lets get started, choose your language". I picked this one because I wanted a minimum 16 MB ram and lots of HD. The selling point though was the processor, very powerful for a laptop in this category - you can get better but you will be into 4 figures. It performs as i would expect so far. I even loaded WOW and it plays without a hitch, pretty god for a laptop with integrated graphics. Now for the one little issue I had. It would NOT work with an external monitor. Would not recognize one and gave a message that it could not use and external monitor "try a different video card or reload the divers". A different video card was not possible. I reloaded the driver and no good. I tried the built in windows tool to find a better driver, and it was useless as they always are. It did show the driver loaded on the adapter was from 2006 !! Holy crap, 17 years old? I was about to re-pack and send it back to Amazon when I decided to try one of those free driver updaters. It found a new driver from 2023, loaded it and bingo - it worked. A 17 year old driver....I was about to give 4 stars just for that but the 3rd party driver updaters are out there and easy to use so if you need to, go that route. Yes it is small and light and some call that "flimsy" but small and light is what I wanted.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great, like new except..
reviewText: I received this computer the day after I ordered it, and it looked as new. I set it up, updated Windows, and found that the SD card reader didn't recognize any cards I put in it. It also didn't recognize another monitor plugged into the HDMI port. I took a clue from another reviewer, downloaded the Driver Booster app, and ran it to find and update drivers. Once that was done, the SD card reader worked, and the second monitor did. So, I am giving this four stars. Those two things should have worked out of the box.After that, I found the computer fast and so far does what I want it to do, but it does have issues running the latest Photoshop, but for the price, I am happy with it. I like the keyboard, and the fact that it is lighted helps in lower light. The computer has a very fast start-up.One thing that is not ideal is the trackpad. It doesn't respond to my input well, and it sometimes has to have my input twice.All in all, I am happy so far with the laptop that I am using to type this now.Two weeks in and It's been great. It charges fast, takes maybe 30 minutes to fully charge, and the battery life is good. The touchpad is great. I have never liked touchpads, but the one on this computer works great.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Choose which seller you buy this from wisely
reviewText: 1st unit bought from seller Chrome Source which was horrible. The mac arrived rattling around inside a medium sized Fedex box. Opened it to find the mac was just wrapped in single sheet of bubble wrap then tossed in the box. No fragile label or anything on the outside. Luckily the cosmetic appearance was still good. However, I tried to power on and battery was completely dead. Plugged it in, turned it on and had to wait about 2 hours for battery to fully charge to test it. Checked the battery life and found the "Battery Service Recommended" warning. It had a total of 749 cycle counts on the battery and 4049 mAh life remaining. Nowhere near the guaranteed 80% battery life or better on this unit. The unit was very dirty, hair and crumbs falling out of keyboard and every port including power port had dirt and lint built up in it. This is by far the worst "renewed" product I have ever bought. I immediately contacted seller, took them 2 days plus going through Amazon customer service to get a response offering to replace. I opted to just return it as I already purchased a second unit from Platinum Deals which showed up very clean, in like new cosmetic condition, packaged well in an aftermarket computer box, full charge on the battery that had 6100 mAh of battery life remaining well over 80%. The second unit I kept. Point is, be careful what seller you go through. I would absolutely buy from Platinum Deals again but will never purchase anything from Chrome Source again. I will be leaving a positive review on the second unit purchased from Platinum Deals.Update: For whatever reason I can only leave a single review even though I purchased 2 of these from 2 different sellers. I am leaving the negative star rating due to my first experience because I feel that is more important for others to see but hopefully my entire review will be read. As far as the 2nd unit purchased from Platinum Deals, I give it 5 stars in all categories.

reviewText: I purchased this MacBook Air after several issues with Amazon and other laptops. It arrived quickly but worked for only one day. Asked for photos of a cosmetically perfect laptop to “send to their quality team” when they were told numerous times that it was a software issue. Escalated to Amazon several times and reported seller. Really cautioning against buying from them. I’ve had a laptop I couldn’t use for almost 2 weeks while they’ve held my money.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best deal for creatives on the go!
reviewText: This 11inch HP is the perfect device for me as a creative coach and freelance designer. It's my second small convertible touchscreen laptop, cost far less money than my first and with every bell and whistle I currently need. It's incredibly versatile and a great option for anyone on the go for work or school.There are two cameras and the clarity of the main cam is phenomenal! I get compliments on how nicely I'm lit when using it. The camera for tablet view is just to the left of my left hand - so you don't have to juggle between them when it's folded back. One can be on the subject and one on you. I haven't played with it much, but it's a cool feature. The touchscreen is very user-friendly.It has Windows 11 and it's as fast on startup and during use as is claimed in the offer. Worth every penny for bootstrapped coaches and entrepreneurs struggling to get work done on an older laptop. I thought about it for about a week because I was considering a more expensive pc, but if I needed to buy for someone else or for myself - I'll be looking for the latest refurbished model just like this one!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very pleased with a "renewed" product
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Purchased 01/2024 Reviewed 04/2024. Preliminary review:1. Item received nicely packaged to prevent damage during shipment2. Overall impression of item when unwrapped: Good looking device - apparently a "skin" was applied to it to coverup any scratches, etc -- liked the look of the skin, slightly textured in appearance & helps with gripping the device. However, not sure of the ability of skin to stay on with prolong handling, one corner of laptop skin keeps pulling away from corner. Solution - I put the laptop in a protective case, which also protects laptop if it should drop/fall3. Setup & operating laptop - setup was easy & have experienced no issues with operating the laptop with the exception of adopting to a new/revised way of accessing information. The windows platform was different on my old HP & I found myself stumbling around trying to find out where to go for stuff like settings, download, documents, volume control - etc. but I've been able to retrain myself to the new setup4. I miss the volume control button that was on the side of the laptop on my old HP, that was so simple to use, but I have since found out I can us the Fkeys to control volume5. Great speed downloading & uploading, for websites & pages on websites6. Vibrant colors on "desktop" type pages & when watching videos, mostly I watch YouTube but have also connected to other internet video services, as I want to use this when traveling for entertainment videos7. Can't comment on gaming, as I don't do it, but from what I've been using it for would say this could be used for school or job related use8. Battery lasts a long time, like the raised keys on keypad area9. Disappointed in the amount of storage on the actual device, my old HP had 1000gb on hrd/drive & this has only 128gb, which seems to be a trend on devices (limited hard drive storage) but when deciding to get this I decided I would use a usb drive & transfer stuff I needed or wanted to keep, so having usb ports was important [I know you can get larger hrd/drive storage, but then the price goes way up]Finally, I was very impressed with this "renewed" item. I didn't know what to expect when I opened the box, but overall item appearance & performance has made me glad I took a chance on this.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Mad I bought this
reviewText: I absolutely loved my first Chromebook, which I bought in 2018. Since it had been awhile, I didn't realize Chromebook wasn't a brand and now everyone has a Chromebook. Because I was so happy with my first one, I checked and Lenovo was the manufacturer. So I figured they got it right the first time. And they were highly rated, you know by the people paid to highly rate companies by the companies. And I had been doing research for a couple months! Boy was I wrong. Even if you get the same cellphone, you expect certain improvements, all things being equal. Someone explain to me how the NEWER laptop is worse than the OLDER laptop! I'm so disgusted, is it weren't for the fact that my old Chromebook had a cracked keyboard and wasn't getting updates, I would have returned it immediately. But I'm lazy and didn't feel like going through the whole process again. But very angry since this is something I'm stuck with for a few years. It's slow beyond belief. It's glitchy beyond belief. YouTube is constantly freezing and the circles keep going so that when you click on the one video you want the whole screen will refresh and down the rabbit hole you go because now you've clicked on something else and now you gotta go back. And if I have two games open, the second game to be open will forever have the task menu bar showing, but the picture isn't adjusted for that so it cuts off the graphics.Oh! Oh! And let's not even talk about the volume. I'd shout but you wouldn't hear it through the Chromebook. Pathetically low volume, but the thing I really didn't understand was that when plugged up, yes plugged, not even Bluetooth, the volume was the same pathetic level as it was on the laptop. Last I checked, we used speakers to get louder, but not with this bad boy. This was not the case with the first Chromebook. I used my old Chromebook as an entertainment system, all the time! Even without speakers it kicked butt, but now the new one- this one, is quieter WITH speakers than the old Chromebook was without!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars HP 14 Laptop: Great for a notebook under $200, But Keep RAM Limitations in Mind
reviewText: The HP 14 is a great choice for those looking for a basic laptop under $200, but it’s not for gamers, designers, or anyone who does more than the basics on their computer. Most surprisingly, it’s even decent for streaming video and for cord cutters who can take advantage of the HDMI port to connect to a larger display.The basics: It comes with Windows 11 Home in S mode, but you can easily switch out of S mode if you need to install additional programs not found on the Microsoft store. I turned it off with 4 minutes of use, so that’s a breeze. And of course, this laptop features a 14-inch 1920 x 1080 display, an Intel Celeron N4020 processor, and 4GB of RAM.**Here are some of the highlights of the HP 14:*** **Great for basic tasks:** The HP 14 can handle basic tasks such as browsing the web, checking email, and using productivity software, but with only 4GB of RAM, I experienced some slowdowns when I had many tabs open in my browser or was running multiple programs at once.* **Long battery life:** The laptop can last up to 6.5 hours on a single charge. I was definitely impressed!* **Comfortable keyboard:** The keyboard is bouncy with a generous click and plenty of room for typing.if you like firmer keyboards, this one may not be your jam.* **SD card slot:** The HP 14 includes an SD card slot, which is a rarity for laptops in this price range.perfect for me,because my trail cam’s card can be emptied daily with ease!* **HDMI port:** as mentioned, this is great for cord cutters who want to connect to a larger display or projector. My last cheap laptop was twice the price of this one and didn’t have an hdmi or a card reader.**Here are some things to keep in mind:*** **Small touchpad:** The touchpad is small and can be difficult to use.* **Dim screen:** The screen is a bit dim and I found it impossible to use outside no matter how I adjusted the display settings.* **Low storage:** 64GB of storage may not be enough for some users.* **Limited RAM:** 4GB of RAM limits multitasking capabilities.I don’t know yet if those last two items are upgradable, but I’ll check into it if things get bogged down over the next few weeks!**Overall, the HP 14 is a great laptop for students, casual users, and anyone looking for a basic laptop under $200, especially if you don't plan on running multiple programs at once. However, if you need a laptop for more demanding tasks, you may want to consider a model with more RAM.**

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Obsolete, not a power house, but great for the money
reviewText: This is the second one I've bought. The first was to donate for our local kid STEM Lego League group. I liked it so much I got another one for me to use in meetings. I gave up on laptops some time ago, no meetings, using a real PC for sw development. But, ever increasing meetings, so this is the perfect solution.It isn't any speed demon, it uses an obsolete Intel Celerion N series processor, has no way to add more internal storage other than the 64G eMMC. But, with 16G of memory, it is actually surprisingly responsive. It's still supported by HP, it's brand new, just discontinued. I don't love the small screen, but it is a 14" screen, so I'll live with it. Comes with Win 11 and surprisingly it's quite responsive running it. Do be aware that it ships with the idiotic S mode Win 11 that locks you to the MS store and such. But, other reviews notwithstanding, follow the unlock directions, no issue at all going to full W 11. It doesn't even have too much of the usual preloaded bloatware. The usual McAfee trash, a bunch of HP 'tools', and a lot of the usual MS garbage. It does come with Office, if you care. I only need Excel, so this is a slight benefit. For $250, this is a no-brainer if you just need something portable for email, spreadsheets, etc.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Beware Microsoft/HP Proprietary Marketing Approach
reviewText: This thing was a pain in the neck to set up any software not purchased at the “Microsoft Store.” Even programs that were pre-loaded on the system as purchased could not be activated or accessed without knowledge of how to access the magic handshake that Microsoft support would not provide. I had to go to individual software providers such as McAfee and Adobe to figure out how to enable commonly used programs. Even setting up an existing HP printer was not for the meek..everything defaults through HP’s cloud and, again, no support from HP to enable local print spooling. The speed and user interface is no better than the 8 y.o. Windows 10 system I replaced (forced obsolescence, because Windows 10 won’t be supported past 2025 and many programs already could not be updated). Then there’s this flash-card approach to local storage…what a cheesy way to force users to buy storage space in the cloud. Now I know why iOS and Google based systems are more expensive and likely worth the premium.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unable to install Ubunut Linux.
reviewText: The laptop was a great price for the horsepower. However, I was unable to get Ubuntu 22.04 to boot up on the laptop. I run Ubuntu Linux on all my computers and rarely have an issue installing on a new computer. This laptop was the exception. I attempted to install Ubuntu 22.04. The installation went smoothly, but the system would not boot up. It kept saying it could not find the file-system. I then attempted to install 24.04. Again, the installation went smoothly, but the system would not boot up. I then attempted to install 20.04. The installation went smoothly and this time the system did boot up. However, when I performed the release upgrade to go from 20.04 to 22.04, the upgrade went smoothly but the system would no longer boot up. I must have tried some 20 installations attempting different BIOS and kernel configurations before finally giving up and returning the laptop. I ended up buying a different HP laptop from Sam's Club with which I had no problems at all installing and booting Ubuntu 22.04.If you are going to stick with the stock Microsoft Windows installation, then this laptop is probably a great buy for you. If you intend to install a Linux installation instead, then you should avoid this laptop.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Love Hate
reviewText: This is a good little computer and it's an annoying little computer. It is good that it is light weight and easily slips into a knapsack with no noticeable weight increase. Watch the battery life, it drains rather quickly and is slow to charge. The unit also cannot be used at night, unless, and this is a big unless, you are a master of the keyboard. The reason I say this is because the keys do not light up. That is a big deal to me, because my last little laptop key's lit up and I could continue to work into the night.Perhaps this is a new feature, or I haven't figured out how to fix it, but the icons line up on the left side of the screen and do not save. Meaning, every time I want to go to Google, I have to manually type it in. I set Google as my default search screen and it always defaults to Bing, another thing I do not like.So, in the end, I believe this was a get what I pay for system. It's good in that it's light weight, the processing speed is awesome, but that could be my internet provider. I do not like how the websites that I go to on a daily basis do not save on a top rack that I can just click on. The keys do not light up and that is a big downer for me.2.5 stars for this unit, but I gave it three, because it really is a solid little computer, the set up is just not to my personal liking.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY IMPRESSED! Great quality & amazing price point!
reviewText: Our 6th grader needed a no frills "laptop" for her assignments at her new private school. They had school-issued ones in public school, but we need to buy one for private school (no prob).I read a few reviews for restored laptops on WMart dot com. They were mostly bad reviews about prpducts that arrived filthy, broken, scratched up, & in terrible shape. So, I decided to come to trusty ol AMZN to see what they had to offer on the "renewed/restored" list. I found this one & took a chance, since I could just get a refund if it arrived in terrible shape. I am so impressed!!!!!! We pulled this right out the box, plugged it up (charger included) and set it up. Clean, no scratches, in excellent (like new) condition. It is not touchscreen, which I knew, but this will do perfectly for my daughter.Full transparency, between 2020-2023 when she was doing digital learning at home due to the original COVID shutdown, she broke about 5 tablets/Chromebooks. She is rough on devices, so I was not thrilled about spending a lot on this school supply.So happy we found this listing. At this price point (under sixty bucks) I'm back today to buy 2 more (one for my 6 year old who wants "his own computer" & a backup for our rough 6th grader). Christmas is in the bag!
