reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Too underpowered to be useful for anything.
reviewText: I saw this item for sale used for a good price and I thought it might be useful as a travel laptop: functional, small, cheap enough that it wouldn't matter if it was broken, spilled on or left behind while traveling internationally. When the Chromebook arrived I checked that it had several years of updates available, and it did. However the Chromebook is too low quality to be any use for anything: the screen is low-res, washed out and awful. The keyboard is so bad it's impossible to type on: although none of the keys was broken, half of my keypresses (on any key) didn't register, and it felt like there was sand under the keys. The hardware is hopelessly under-powered for basic web browsing tasks like reading email: having even 2 or 3 tabs open slowed the machine to a crawl. And the laptop isn't particularly small or light. I pity any schoolchild who has to do homework on this, it's a terrible experience to use. I returned mine for a refund.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on October 31, 2023
reviewTitle: Poor Attention to Detail on Refurb
reviewText: Firstly, the chromebook I received has less ports than the images on the Amazon page. On the Amazon page each side of the chromebook has 1 x USB port and 1 x USB-C port, for a total of 4 ports. On the chrome book I received only one side has ports, for a total of 2 ports.Secondly, the keyboard was filthy. It didn't go through a basic cleaning process, so my first experience with the device was scrapping gunk off the keys. This wasn't even regular grey/brown finger keyboard gunk either, it was orangey-red. The only time I've seen gunk like this was when I drank too much wine in university and puked everywhere and it was somewhat dry the next morning. Pehaps that's even what happened to this chromebook.On a possibly related note to the filthy keyboard, the '8' key does not reliably work. It needs to be pressed very hard for the pressing of the key to register. It is possible other keys have this issue, I've only noticed the one so far.There is also a crack in the frame above the tracking pad. If everything else was okay, I wouldn't let this get to me, but a crack in the frame is more than the 'superficial' imperfections that were advertised.I would be returning this unit immediately, but I need a laptop in a couple days for work. It does seem like it would be a decent unit if it were new or atleast didn't have keyboard issues.What I received was clearly not what was advertised.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars HP does not honor warranty
reviewText: I thought this was just the right PC for us. We don't need much, web browsing, some gaming, some MS Office work. Yesterday I saw that the laptop OS needed update so started it. Noticed it was taking some time so I just let it do its thing all day. Went to turn the laptop back on that evening, and got a flash from the monitor but nothing else. I knew it wasn't a power issue because the separate mouse (not included) was lit, indicating it was connected. Tried everything I could think of then went to HP website. HP tells me there's 15 days left on the warranty ("whew!") and gave me repair options (phone, chat, local warranty provider [Best Buy]). I chose to go to Best Buy. They worked on the laptop for about 25 minutes, and while I can't tell exactly what was done, I do know it was a series of keystrokes and a flash drive. Geek Squad hands the laptop back to me and tells me it's a hardware issue and not worth the cost of repair. I take the laptop back home and get in a chat with technical support. They have me do what appears to be the same steps Geek Squad did. Then they tell me I need an empty flash drive to reset/reinstall the BIOS. Now I'm not really that tech savvy, but I know enough to tell the technician that all the steps that they have had me do I already had done by Geek Squad, their authorized repair center. Tech tells me that without doing that last step with the empty flash drive they cannot determine that it is truly a hardware issue (really??!) and that they won't be able to give me a repair/replacement if I don't take that last step.Sorry, HP, but you cannot convince me that the cost of a replacement laptop is worth more than the bad taste in my mouth, and my withering review (not only on Amazon, but to anyone who asks) of your inability to honor your very limited warranty. I can't imagine why you wouldn't send a replacement of a low-end laptop just to keep positive goodwill towards your customers. And it's why I strongly suggest anyone reading this review to search for a different unit.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wrong Operating System
reviewText: Update: The seller got back to me and after sending them a few pics, they sent me a valid key and now everything is great.The product description says Windows 11 Pro. It should be the Pro version though. When I got the product, a secondary label was put on the box and it says Windows 11 Pro. However, when I go through the setup, Windows 11 Pro is installed on the computer but it does not have the correct Product Key/Digital License for Windows 11 Pro. The troubleshooter says the computer has a valid license for Windows 11 Home. I've sent a message to the seller to get a valid key for 11 Pro. I'll update my review once I get a response from them.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Couldn't be happier
reviewText: I got this refurbished or 'used' with some hesitation but trusted positive reviews about the seller, and I couldn't be happier. This worked straight out of the box - hit power button, operating system loaded and ready to go. It's plenty fast for me which is email, surfing web and streaming, that's really about all I use or need it for. I will agree with others the battery is lousy, don't know if it came semi-depleted or they're just lousy batteries, but I've had this for a year and I'm lucky if it lasts an hour. Just ordered replacement. But will say after a year of use no issues with the laptop itself, which came in for around $175 as I recall. I bought the purchase protection plan for 2 years just in case, maybe another $40 but touch wood have no needed it. I'd say buy with confidence.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price
reviewText: Ok, I will try not to go too long in my review. Because I have waited a LONG time just to get this (long story short, UPS couldn't find my place, sent it back to headquarters or whatever, had to get a refund and reorder it AGAIN) that now, I could see how this laptop holds up. And so far, it holds up pretty well. The laptop was in a box and another, smaller box. Very well packaged. The cord was wrapped up nicely to the side. When I opened the laptop, it was fully charged, which was nice. Now, you could get a mouse for it if you are not fond of the touch screen because they have two USB ports. I am using 1 port for a fan to help cool it and know the 2nd one I could use a mouse...or charge my phone. Whatever.I also like the fact that this has 8gb...I have seen a lot higher prices for just 4gb so, to get this, with 8, very nice features, good ratings, all for a price of around $250 or so (taxes and such), this laptop was worth the (unfortunately long) wait. I will continue to work on this more and see if there are any cons. I do know I get a 90 day warranty, which is also a nice bonus.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast, sleek, love the feel, an amazing buy
reviewText:
I bought this laptop for use in my new home-based business. My old computer was slow. This one is amazingly fast, and I love that it has Windows 10 Pro. I have seen this same computer listed at Walmart for $1500, and this computer has everything I need. Setup and update was the fastest and easiest I have ever experienced on any computer.I have only had this for a few days, so I'm sure I will discover even more features as time goes by, but for now, here are my favorite things about this computer.
  • It works flawlessly with a second monitor hooked up to it
  • It has a 10-key option built into the keyboard. If you hold down the Fn button on the left side of the keyboard, you can use the 10-key function with your right hand. I thought about attaching a second keyboard to this so I would have 10-key, but now I don't have to.
  • The power cord plugs into the back instead of into the side, which just works out better for me.
  • This computer is lightning fast. I can have 10 or more open tabs on my web browser, and it doesn't slow down a bit!
  • I don't know what it is about it, but the touchpad just feels nicer and seems easier to use. The surface of the touch pad and the area around it is textured. Maybe this is what makes it easier. Also, the buttons are where you can see them, rather than hidden within the touch pad.
  • Mine does have a backlit keyboard, but do be aware that this is a luck-of-the-draw feature. Not all of these will have that.
  • The battery life seems to be really long. I have not used it away from my desk much, but during the few times that I have left it unplugged for a few hours, I noticed very little drain on the battery compared to my old laptop.
  • The picture is very high-quality. I have a second monitor hooked up to it, which is also brand new, and other than the monitor being larger, I do not discern any difference in the picture quality.
I will say it would have been nice if it had a touch-screen, but with all this laptop's good features and qualities, I adapted very quickly to not having a touchscreen.I am sure there are a lot of other things to love about this laptop, which I will discover over time. I will keep updating this review as I find more awesome features. I was a little nervous about getting a refurbished computer, but I am so glad I did. I never could have gotten this caliber of a computer within my budget, and it is what I needed. This is the best investment I have made into my new business so far.I use this computer for office and business-related tasks. I put it through a pretty good load with a lot of multitasking during use, in ways my old laptop could not tolerate. It seems to have the resources to handle everything I throw at it. I was thinking I would just buy a lower-cost laptop for now, then get a more expensive one once I get my business off the ground, but this one is a keeper!I do not know how this would perform for gaming, as I am not a gamer and have never tried any gaming. I just know it has everything I wanted in a laptop for business needs. If you need a computer for work or just for general everyday use, I highly recommend this one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Built like a tank and almost as heavy
reviewText: What I like:It is built like a tank and will probably resist careless handling better than cheaper model computers.Sufficient memory to run the newer applications like Windows, 11, and Microsoft office as well as casual use photo editing, such as for making reports and magazine articles to submit.Really loving the back lighted keyboard, and the fact that the keys require a slightly harder tap then the cheap knock offs do. It's more like a typewriter and less like a cell phone if that gives you an idea.It is already anti-glare screen. You interferes with your sleeping ability if you work at night so you don't have to buy a separate blue light filter.Display is nice and crisp.What I do not like:The back lighted keyboard times out fairly quickly, and goes dark again. There's probably a set for that. I haven't figured out.The processor is slow,(by standards available in March 2024) so if you care about streaming, high definition, video or high resolution games, like second life, you might have to do a little wizard to scale down your settings and expectations.Incidentally, the tech papers I saw said you cannot overclock this model, so you're out of luck there.this thing is incredibly heavy compared to newer computers of similar size and even 17 inch ones! That makes it unpleasant to take to the café to work on with other writers... if you have a physical handicap, I do not recommend that you buy a computer this heavy.if you have a physical handicap or weak hand strength, I do not recommend that you buy a computer this heavy.(I regret the impulse buy, but it was an excellent deal and much needed.)The battery also seems to get tired quicker than my old Acer computer, but it is a much higher horsepower as far as the amount of memory it runs so perhaps that's the trade-off.(I am not saying the battery is bad)The cord is bulky but again it was cutting edge six years ago so I can't really complain too much that it is taking a lot of room and relatively heavy compared to any other device I have.(hoping this makes it resistant to small animals chewing it.)😝Like a ferret or a bunny or a cat... or even a budgie! Yeah seriously.(pets will be pets.)----------------(anti-monopoly, software rant... skip ahead if you like)Frankly, I hate the layout of Windows 10 and 11, but I am also chronically angry about Microsoft and Google and Apple dominating the digital world so there you go...* nothing* short of open source code, and lowering the monthly rental fee for their software like Word and Photoshop to something like five dollars a month for home users, will appease me - and other nerdy people who have taken the red Matrix pill if you know what I mean, -and allowing us to download an *actual copy * of the program, so we own what we are paying for , instead of forcing us to rent this stuff, and use the cloud - if you have Financial hard times, you are up a creek, )I am also vigorously opposed to saving my stuff in the cloud. But that is a problem with Google and certain other applications, and they do know exactly what they're doing if you read the business reports .It is nobody else's business what I work on and if I work on it, and where I choose to save it... they certainly don't have my permission to keep a copy (did you know they were sued for academic infringement roughly 20 years ago when they stole stuff to post on Google scholar ???)which they automatically do and you cannot prevent unless you do not use Google at all(!!!).----------------------But that is more of a gunboat marketing monopoly tactic that has nothing to do with the quality of the hardware I am holding. They are hostage to the system as much as I am. (manufacturers, build what they are told to build so they can get paid.)That said this was a over $2000 computer, six years ago when the processor was new release. I am satisfied it will serve me for at least the next three years.I will also note that it does not fit as easily into certain laptop, protective sleeves, and cases that are designed for 14 to 15 inch machines. Because it's kind of fat.! LolLike a tank😜but that is part of why I bought a brand-name and not a cheap knockoff from overseas that will probably break when I sneeze.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Beware of OLIVE Computers - Defective Laptop and Unfair Return Fee
reviewText: I purchased a Dell Latitude 7490 from OLIVE Computers on the Amazon Renewed store, and the experience was extremely disappointing. The laptop arrived with a range of defects: the left mouse button did not work, the back cover of the laptop was loose, and, to top it off, they did not include a USB-C charger, which is essential for this product.I decided to return it immediately due to these issues, but to my surprise, OLIVE Computers charged me a ridiculous 15% restocking fee! This is completely unjustified as the return was due to the defective condition of the laptop, not a change of mind. I have since filed an Amazon A-Z claim, as this is covered by the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.For anyone considering buying from OLIVE Computers, be cautious! Their poor quality control and unfair business practices make them a seller to avoid. Save yourself the headache and choose a more reliable vendor.Final Advice: Don’t fall victim to predatory companies like this. Read reviews and take action!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality
reviewText: After unpacking this laptop, I looked and scrutinized the whole unit. I was very impressed, because this refurbished model looked brand new! No scratches, No dents, extremely clean!The setup of windows 10 Pro was a breeze, even the 10 G network over Thunderbolt was / is extremely fast. The i7 CPU, 16 Gb Ram, and Thunderbolt work together extremely well. It only took a few minutes to get "everything" set up. After imaging the drive to my NAS for safety reasons, I upgraded to Windows 11 Pro. Now I'm even more impressed! Absolutely error free upgrade to Windows 11 Pro. I'm using a Sonnettech Solo 10 G SFP+ Thunderbolt connection and it is crazy FAST. Reinstalling my software went through error free and really quick. I can definitely recommend this seller and would definitely buy from them again. I definitely feel that I purchased a very good refurbished laptop. Naturally, the 14" screen is too small for me, but the HDMI port connects to a 27" Samsung curved monitor which is perfect for me. Having a USB 3.1 hub with 3 ports helps when connection ports are limited. I did notice that 3 keys on the keyboard needed a little TLC because they wouldn't respond 100% correct, but after Q-tip cleaning they worked as designed 😉.I'm very surprised and happy with this purchase!One month update:I have put this laptop through the paces of rigorous office work and high speed network compatibility using a 10 Gb SFP+ Thunderbolt connection. This is awesome!It works flawlessly on my 10 Gb network and can do a complete laptop NVMe drive image in under 7 minutes. Even after the update to Windows 11 Pro the system is running great.If you need a reliable and fast laptop, then check out this seller, good quality and fast delivery, but hurry, they are selling out fast!

reviewText: This was a purchase for my daughter, and she wanted to buy her own Chromebook with her own money. We found this one that was within the price range she was looking for. When she received the laptop it worked for about 2 days without any issues. Then it started randomly rebooting on her in the middle of using it and would not turn back on. She plugged it in to charge thinking the battery was dead on multiple times, and it would only restart on like the 50th try. Then it would stop working, reboot and repeat again. I called asurion to make a claim. They told me due to the multiple issues they could not replace or fix the Chromebook and referred me back to Amazon for a replacement. Amazon told me they could not replace the item, they could only refund the money. So my frustration is that I purchased a protection plan that can't be honored, and also a device that can't be fixed. I'd be furious if I hadn't bought the protection plan and Amazon wouldn't have refunded the money.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Slow piece of crap
reviewText: It's cheap and can maybe help a poor college student who doesn't have much money, but don't expect to do much else with this clunky, languid hunk of plastic - I have just got this thing as of a few hours ago and have all but on thing open (Chrome - which you MUST disable S-mode to use) and the words are lagging as I'm typing this review - which is unfortunate because this device also has some unresponsive keys so I'm having to return frequently and make sure that I haven't (actually the device, but I'll be generous and take the fault) misspelt anything. Don't even think about opening more than one tab; the device will start spinning and start asking you how to deal with unresponsive pages should you attempt to open even so much as *one* additional tab while you've got only one open. I have just attempted to test this while typing my review, and not only did it need to reload the page on a tab I already had open prior to this, attempting to return to this page after the frustration generated by trying to revisit a page I already had opened resulted in this page freezing and needing to reload before I could continue my review. This is because the thing uses eMMC storage, which I am now finding out is notoriously slow. Get this thing because you are poor and only need it for one thing, and pray that it can even do that one thing reasonably.EDITED AGAIN: It's almost comical how bad this thing is; the first few attempts I made at connecting it to the my network ended in failure, only for the 4th time to be successful. The device froze and became totally unresponsive and I was forced to turn it off and turn it back on (it was laboring under the burden of 3 tabs being open), at which point I had to turn it off and on AGAIN because it wasn't able to reboot after being restarted. It installed some updates (lol), and then proceeded to lose internet connectivity again, this time taking at least 6 attempts, manually, to get it to connect. Moreover, it does not display any icons on the taskbar, you have to hover the mouse icon over them in order to get their names to display in order to figure out what you're clicking on.I recently suggested that this thing should be used only for school purposes and nothing else, but after seeing what a craptastic job it did of facilitating MyMathLab, I'm halfway reconsidering even giving it commendations for scholastic or educational purposes; it took it 8 tries to finally display anything in MyMathLab, and that was WITH pop-ups enabled, on a browser recommended for use by MML.The mouse pad is also frequently unresponsive. Really, just don't get this awful contraption.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well balanced budget system
reviewText: This is an excellent value for a budget notebook and I've bought and re-sold dozens of these from approximately September 2023 to February 2024. They are not perfect; in particular I wish that the least expensive model came with a more reasonable 500GB SSD rather than 250GB and that they keyboard didn't have the compact numeric keypad, but it does so many other things right that many budget notebooks get very, very wrong.There's a solid build quality to the Ideapad 1. The chassis doesn't bend or flex, which is atypical among low-cost options. The keyboard is quite comfortable in spite of being off-center due to the aforementioned numeric keypad, and the touchpad is easily up to the standards of mainstream and premium devices, unlike those found in familiar low-cost offerings from Acer or HP. The display is very bright and lives up to the common Full HD (1920x1080) spec. It's not a super high resolution display, but it does display color faithfully and accurately. It has three USB type A and one type C port.An AMD Ryzen 7320U won't exactly set the world on fire for performance, but it has four full-performance cores (8 threads), better-than-Intel graphics capability and substantially better power efficiency compared to the i3-1215U that is probably its most direct competitor. It's not ideal for content creation or gaming, but it's very well balanced for a ~$330 general purpose notebook. Another down side to this particular model is that it has soldered RAM rather than DIMMs. I suspect a lot of people would never even think to upgrade the RAM in a budget notebook and I do think 8GB is fair enough for the price.As far as gaming goes, it's just OK for older games. Minecraft, Roblox and World of Warcraft players probably won't complain. It's just not a good choice for your Cyberpunk or Cities Skylines 2 needs.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Superb for the money!
reviewText: I am thoroughly impressed with the HP Pavilion 15.6" FHD Laptop! From its sleek design to its impressive performance, this laptop has exceeded all my expectations. The 15.6" Full HD display delivers crisp, vibrant visuals, making it perfect for both work and entertainment. Whether I'm editing photos, watching movies, or browsing the web, the clarity and color accuracy are top-notch.The performance is equally impressive. Powered by a reliable processor and ample RAM, it handles multitasking and demanding applications with ease. I've used it for everything from work presentations to light gaming, and it never lags or slows down. The laptop boots up quickly, and the overall speed is fantastic for everyday use.The keyboard is comfortable to type on, with well-spaced keys that make long typing sessions a breeze. The trackpad is smooth and responsive, adding to the overall user-friendly experience. Battery life is solid, easily lasting through a full workday with normal use, which is a huge plus when I’m on the go.Overall, the HP Pavilion 15.6" FHD Laptop offers great value for money with its powerful performance, stunning display, and sleek design. Whether you're a student, professional, or casual user, this laptop is a fantastic choice. I highly recommend it!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super responsive, fast, sleek, compact
reviewText: I've received the computer about 20 days ago, and it's fantastic. It is very responsive with all commands, has a great sound system, very lightweight and compact, very fast to use and to boot up, the keyboard is great, no scratches at all. The software, display, operating system, and hardware capacities are all incredible. The camera covering lid is also a game changer for me. It came in with the box and the charger, 0 details at all, except that some keys from the keyboard seem a bit dirty (see images attached) , which is the only downside I'm able to find with it, as well as the lack of a LAN port (which is something that I honestly overlooked while looking for a computer). I've only used it for 20 days so I'm not sure if the dirt on the keys is because of me.I tried a couple of games, and I would say that it isn't 100% optimized for gaming, which I don't really mind, since I bought it for university and work. Still, I would say overall I'm very satisfied with it!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Impressive Renewed Business Laptop - HP 17.3" HD Touchscreen
reviewText: Recently, I had the opportunity to experience the renewed HP 17.3" HD Touchscreen Business Laptop, and my overall satisfaction is noteworthy. Let's delve into the notable features and considerations:Pros:Speed and Generous Storage: The laptop, equipped with an AMD Ryzen 5-5500U processor, 16GB RAM, and a combination of 512GB SSD and 1TB HDD, delivers swift performance. The expansive 17.3" touchscreen enhances productivity by providing ample workspace.Windows 11 Pro Elegance: The laptop comes pre-installed with Windows 11 Pro, contributing an elevated level of sophistication and advanced functionalities for an enhanced user experience.Numeric Keypad Convenience: The inclusion of a numeric keypad is a thoughtful addition, offering practicality for tasks that involve frequent numerical input.Versatile Connectivity: HDMI, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and a Webcam provide an array of connectivity options, catering to diverse user needs.Cons:Charging Speed: A minor drawback is the charging speed, which falls short of expectations. Users who rely on quick top-ups while on the move may find this aspect slightly inconvenient.Conclusion:In summary, the renewed HP 17.3" HD Touchscreen Business Laptop impresses with its performance and screen size. While the charging speed is a minor concern, it doesn't significantly impact the laptop's overall functionality.Pros:Swift performance and ample storageWindows 11 Pro sophisticationNumeric keypad convenienceDiverse connectivity optionsCons:Charging speedDespite this minor inconvenience, the renewed HP laptop stands out as a reliable choice for business-oriented users seeking a spacious screen and robust performance.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Junk
reviewText: Bought two of these and had to return both. The first one arrived and had a defective wireless card and would not connect to a network, which is required to set up Win11 (no ethernet port on this laptop). So I returned it and purchased another one same day as I shipped the return because I could not wait 3 weeks for an exchange. The second one arrived 3 days later and I did manage to get it set up and it worked fine for a couple of days. Then it would no longer power on. Completely dead. Tried leaving it connected to charger overnight. Still dead next morning. So I returned that one as well. And bought an Acer instead (which works great!).Be careful to review the return policy. Amazon does clearly states the return policy, but buyer beware. Both of my purchases were from Amazon Marketplace sellers, marked with Amazon Prime and "Shipped from Amazon". Amazon will not refund computer purchases until after they receive the item back and have time to inspect the product. Then it takes 7 days to go back to your credit card. It is not like most Prime purchases where you get the refund almost immediately after UPS scans the return package.On my first return, it took 3 weeks. That was from Seller "Snow Bell" and I eventually got a full refund. Then the second return took another 3 weeks, so I was carrying $1200 on my credit card while having to purchase a third replacement elsewhere (another $700 on my credit card). And now I am fighting with Seller named "AmazingDeal Arrived" on the second return as they are trying to charge me a $231 "restocking fee" despite the fact the laptop was damaged/defective and the restocking fee is inapplicable. Very frustrating and basically had to put $2k on my credit card and carry $1200 for 3-6 weeks waiting for refunds.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sleek, modern, workhorse
reviewText: The 15.6-inch Full High Definition (FHD) Touchscreen Dell Inspiron 15 3000 Series 3511 Laptop with an Intel Core i5-1035G1 processor and an outstanding 32GB of RAM was a recent purchase of mine. I must say that in every way this laptop has surpassed my expectations and is now an integral part of my everyday life.This laptop's primary strength is its outstanding performance. Thanks to the Intel Core i5-1035G1 processor's lightning-fast performance and responsiveness, I can run a wide variety of programs simultaneously with no effort. The 32GB of RAM significantly improves performance, allowing you to work efficiently and without interruptions even when using busy programs.The 15.6-inch full-high-definition (FHD) touchscreen is a joy to work with. Images and videos have never looked so crisp and detailed. The touch features are quick and precise, making my work much simpler and more pleasant than before.The sturdy construction and long lifespan of this laptop further amaze me. The construction is sturdy, and the style is sleek and modern, giving off an air of professionalism. The keyboard's layout and key spacing make for a pleasant typing experience.The Dell Inspiron 15 3000 Series 3511 has an excellent battery life. I'm not interrupted by the need to look for a power source, so I can focus on my work for longer periods of time. This convenience is especially useful for people who are frequently on the go.This laptop has a plethora of ports, making it ideal for use with a wide variety of peripherals. I appreciate the ease with which I can transfer and access my files thanks to the inclusion of USB ports, HDMI, and an SD card reader. I would definitely recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a solid, dependable laptop.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for what you're paying
reviewText: We bought this for our daughter. She loves Chromebooks because of her experience with them at school, so she requested a Chromebook for Christmas instead of a PC. I wasn't expecting much of anything out of this thing because I knew the price that I paid. I was sooooo wrong.I purchased it in "Excellent Condition" and it lives up to that. It looks brand new in every way. It also came significantly earlier than expected. I would recommend the seller any day.In terms of performance, I've tested out some of her favorite apps. It's more than capable of any streaming service, and it was able to run some of the most difficult Roblox games without issue. It does take a little longer to load some things, but that was expected. The touchscreen is very accurate and responsive. The screen also folds back completely, giving a tablet option (if you're looking for that). Honestly, I'm so excited to give this to her. Now that I know it's not a "well this is the best we could do" kind of thing, I'm confident that she'll be in love with it.If you're on the market for a budget Chromebook with good performance, just trust that this has all of the things you'll need. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars More Negatives than Positives
reviewText: Unfortunately, this was one of those purchases where the negatives out weighed the positives. The positives are that it's a working lap top for 80 bucks and it's a Chromebook, so it will probably keep working. The negatives were: (a) the enclosed power cord was so wrong for the computer that it wouldn't even plug and I had to order a new one; (b) it was advertised as a 2020 model and the sticker on the back plainly says 2019. This matters with a Chromebook because they have updates for a limited number of years and once the updates are over, so is the computer. So, this effectively knocked a year of usage off the laptop. Finally, the screen of the computer very definitely does NOT fold over as shown in the pictures - it's a standard 45 degree hinge. I've been very pleased with refurbished electronics on Amazon in the past and consider them a wonderful deal. The quality control from this company, however, is either incredibly poor or just plain fraudulent. Not worth the hassle of returning, but very definitely not satisfactory.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!
reviewText: I read all the reviews and had a few concerns, but after receiving the laptop they turned out to be no issue!First, the laptop was well packed and basically appeared brand new! As an IT professional, I did what I'd normally do with ANY used laptop. The first was I downloaded Windows 10 Pro, 64bit from Microsoft and created an installation media on a USB drive. Inserted the drive in the laptop and booted up from the USB by pressing F12. I chose to do a new install keeping nothing. Deleted all existing disk partitions. And proceeded with the install on the unallocated disk space. Then I proceeded to Windows update and let that update everything. Next I went to Dell's website for the Lattitude 7280, went to the diganostics and downloaded and ran their Support Assist. From there I picked to run all the tests. There were a few more updates, but everything got a pass on the hardware tests. Finally, I installed Avast & Malwarebytes Antivirus and CCleaner to protect things and keep it happily running!The main concerns I had were the backlit keyboard not working and poor battery performance... I'm happy to report the backlight on mine DOES work, and the battery seems to hold a charge for a good amount of time - like a new laptop should!At $135, this was an absolute steal!!! I've only had it for a day, but I couldn't be happier... this is EXACTLY what I was looking for!!!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good School Computer, Can Handle Easy Games (Minecraft)
reviewText: The battery life is amazing on this computer. I could use it nearly all day off of the charger. If you don't know anything about computers, it has a generally low RAM, meaning it cannot handle running big programs all at once (i.e. multiple browsing tabs+Microsoft Word+Microsoft PowerPoint+Spotify) without a noticeable lag. However, it for some reason you wanted to play Minecraft during your history class (but you shouldn't), you can limit your screen to a browser and the game, and it'll work fine. It has a lot of storage and a lot of accessories available online. It has multiple USB ports, a headphone jack, a card reader, a card tapper, and some other ports for other cables I have yet to encounter. It is the perfect work computer for after you move on from school and it will probably last that long. The CORE i5 mine came with will tell you it cannot not run Windows 11 (but you can find ways around that. Just don't tell anyone I told you that).

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Unbeatable for the price and GREAT customer service
reviewText: This refurb laptop provides much better specs and performance for $150 than you would get for a $150 new laptop. Granted, the 6th gen i5 and Intel HD graphics are somewhat out-of-date but they are still great for everyday tasks and productivity. I also like how the SSD & RAM are upgradeable, and there is a second RAM slot so it only costs about $15 to buy a second stick of RAM and bring the total to 16GB. And while it is not “officially” upgradeable to Windows 11, I sideloaded it and I’ve got Windows 11 running great on this laptop. The 1080p full HD display is also a definite plus for a laptop of this price. My only complaints are that the laptop arrived with a subpar battery but I contacted the seller and they responded within the hour that a new one was on the way. The keyboard also isn’t backlit but that’s no big deal for me - but if it is to you than I would recommend you confirm with the seller first that it has a backlit keyboard. Overall this laptop is amazing considering its low $150 price tag.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Large display, but Color and Speakers just ok
reviewText: I love my new laptop, but the colors displayed on screen are just ok...not very vibrant, average for my own use, and can be fixed a bit tilting the screen at a better angle. I was online shopping and some of the clothing looked very light and images were not very saturated...I wouldn't recommend this for anyone using this laptop for design etc. Good for basic home use, work use, student use. Beautiful background themes to choose from, excellent Google product use, and I easily installed a wireless bluetooth mouse. The screen is nice and large, especially at this price point of around $200. I bought this on Prime Day and I'm happy with my purchase. I can run Google with many tabs open without any problem. I do wish the speakers were a bit better. I listen to music on my phone or Alexa instead because the speakers are small and located in an odd place....right on the front outer rim of the laptop on either side of where it opens. I used it to watch a movie on my bed and had the volume at max and still had a little trouble hearing everything. The bedding also sometimes blocked the speakers because of their location. Basic volume on regular Zoom meetings, YouTube etc. would be fine. I recommend this laptop for normal basic use...it works fast, beautifully designed and has lots of ports which is very convenient. Another thing I wanted to mention is that it wouldn't turn on at first even after charging for hours. I had googled many troubleshooting ideas and nothing seemed to work. Finally after cursing it and almost giving up, it magically made a "bling" sound and came on. Make sure to charge it from a wall outlet; not an extension cord or power strip. I think it was still in shipping mode, so I had to google what keys to hold down to make it boot up for the first time. There are just those few things, otherwise I love the laptop for my needs, and would recommend Asus products. Touchpad is very quick and responsive. It is not a touch screen monitor...I'm thinking people are confusing touch screen with touch pad. Keyboard is comfortable and battery has been long-running.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BEST Bang for buck for Chromebook
reviewText: I got the 15 inch, i needed this mostly for a good laptop, long battery life, USB C Charging, and price. I looked at several "higher" contenders, but for the 8g RAM, 64gb HD plus SD Card slot, battery life, size, and quality, you're not going to find a better sub- $300 chromebook. All others that compare are closer to $600-1000.Battery life isn't quite 11 hours with the most recent updates, more like 6-8. I use this primarily for online EHR for the facility I work for, and it's great. While some may not like the screen with more advanced (read as >$750 models), it is also a little blah appearing screen BECAUSE of the anti-glare. This means I can chart and do notes outside without sacrificing efficiency. Overall, the only "missing" thing is a touch screen. My main laptop is a Surface Pro 7, so I'm not really missing this. This is a fantastic true "lap" top.Unlike others, I have used other Chromebooks. This is superior for the PRICE.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Limited by Mac OS Obsilesence, But Great All The Same
reviewText: It came free with a shell in a nice black color, it boots and runs well and has a decent battery life. I actually like that it's limited in what it can run, but that's just me, because it is mostly for writing and working. I have found ways to install older Mac writing and presentation software for my job. The highest priority was that it can open and run the latest version of QLab, which it does effortlessly. It also runs a few other theatrical programs I need to.Pros:Works well, good battery life, and boots easilyDistraction free work environment, and light weight to take anywhereHDMI port installed rather than needing connection for HDMIUSB Hubs all work as intended.Great inexpensive way to get a Mac for exclusive software like QLabCons:The OS is kneecapped by apple, by design, and there's not really a work around.Charging cable is super shortA little slow running anything, largely due to ageOverall, I highly enjoy my silly little laptop. It's kind of charming and goofy, and a good introduction to Apple for a PC user. After all, if I mess it up, I just wipe it and start again. Runs the basic software I need without much extra. Travels well, and provides me a 2 computer setup for when I need to run lights and sound for an event. I really am glad these renewed options exist for purchase. However, don't think it will run everything under the sun, it won't, but if you know that going in... It'll be just fine, and perfectly serviceable.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Laptop was in worse condition than described.
reviewText: I knew when buying a renewed laptop it was going to have it's minor flaws. As amazon states in the description, "excellent condition" is as "Excellent (Screen: no scratches. Body: no signs of cosmetic damage (scratches, dents, etc.) will be visible when the product is held 12 inches away)." and "Fully Functional (exceeds 80% of original battery life, generic or OEM accessories and packaging provided)."This laptop came filthy with hair, dust, and other junk within the keyboard and on the screen. The charger also came in the same condition with noticeable stains on it as if it was never cleaned. Furthermore, the keyboard was making weird clicking noises when pressing down some of the keys (ex. the arrow keys, alt, or space bar). The top right corner of the keyboard cover was also warped as if some sort of liquid had been spilled on the laptop, also somewhat consistent with the key board noises. Finally the screen had a large 6-7 inch scratch noticeable from well over 12 inches away, as well as additional scratches near it as if a cat had walked across the screen a time or two.Overall the macbook and its physical parts were okay and working good, but the cosmetic condition was no where near as described. The laptop was returned for a refund.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great reliable product
reviewText: First impression:Great bank for the money. I was concerned with buying a five year old laptop but apple makes a great product. I’ve always bought windows PCs so this is my first apple PC. I have to say I’m Impressed. It looks and feels sturdy.Functionality:It runs smoothly and USB data transfer speeds are much faster than my windows PC with an i7 quad core processor. Video playback even at 4k quality runs smoothly. The screen quality is good. I see no problems with it but it doesn’t amaze me like my Windows PC that was almost double the price of this MacBook Pro. The keyboard is simple and easy to use with built-in lights. The built-in speakers are are loud and clear which is huge plus for me. The power adapter is also well designed.Connectivity:The early 2015 MacBook Pro 13in doesn’t have a CD drive but it has a Hmdi port, 2 USB ports, 2 lightning ports, a head phone jack, and a memory card slot. Wifi and YouTube cast works but I don't have an apple tv to test desktop cast or a TV with airplay.Because it’s my first Mac PC I had to google basic features, commands, and how to use the MacBook.Overall I wouldn’t hesitate to buy another MacBook in the future

reviewText: Macbook pros are expensive and this was an excellent price given the amount of RAM and storage - the only problem was that the charger was damaged on arrival. There were cracks in the plastic that looked like age where and the block part had exploded. There was no obvious damage the box. The lap was fine and works well. It was confusing at first re: what to do because I had purchased the Asurion policy - and I wanted to keep the laptop and just credit for the charger. Asurion initially said to try to get the refund from Amazon and send it all back - but this would invalidate the coverage of the laptop or potentially require me to refund the laptop although there was no other one available at that price with those specs.Amazon pointed fingers at Asurion and Asurion pointed fingers at Amazon say it was due to their delivery, but the seller came through and offered either to give me another charger, or refund me $20 to buy a new one (I took the latter). In truth, the charger looked to be in poor condition on arrival and probably shouldn't have been approved by the seller, but I appreciate they stood by their product and gave me the refund. For me to buy another refurbished one would have cost me twice the price from Apple. So 5 stars for BuySPRY standing by their product.

reviewText: I mainly use my MacBook for productivity as well as for more intensive applications like virtualisation which it handles well. The keyboard gets uncomfortably hot and the backside can get burning hot, so much so I have to control the fans manually.I’d rate MacBook’s condition as average. On the surface the laptop was clean, however, the display’s anti-reflective coating was noticeably peeling (which looks like the picture I have attached) and the ports were also noticeably dirty. When I opened the inside the computer was incredibly dusty and dirty with grime buildup everywhere; the fans were even clogged by the dust buildup–it clearly had not been cleaned which I would have expected from a refurbished product. Additionally, charger supplied, although genuine, appears heavily used. It has multiple scratches and is bit grime, but works great.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 4.5 I love this Mac…but I have some small concerns
reviewText: When it arrived, the MacBook was very well packed! This is my third Renewed Mac from Amazon. So I do know that there are going to be some minor defects or issues.That being said….honestly, I was impressed!It’s almost like new…with a small problem. When I went to remove the sticker on the laptop,(it had a sticker for inventory I’m assuming) the whole sticker and back portion of the screen aluminum side started to peel.Now, I did wonder why it felt a bit different than my other macs….and this was why.I really don’t think the seller did this on purpose, rather it was done by the original owner? To be fair, it was well done, almost didn’t notice it, until I started to remove the inventory sticker.Still not a deal breaker.Underneath was one scratch, most likely from normal use. It’s not a big deal, nor does it affect the how it functions.The MacBook is running in the latest OS, which I downloaded with no issue and also installed all my necessary programs with no problems!I do have a program that does bog it down sometimes, but I really feel that it’s how I’m using it not the MacBook.My only concern is the battery. Seems to die rather quickly for a Mac. But again, it’s mainly used at home for my music programs…and it’s very easy to switch out an old battery or memory on these machines (hint hint).The screen is perfect, no blemishes or scratches. And the keys show the tinniest wear, again, not a big deal.It did come with a new charger and cable! Brand new Apple charger! A big win! The last ones I bought came with aftermarket chargers and cables.Like I said, small minimal blemishes that really don’t affect performance and it looks amazing!I also did add a protective cover…Smokey gray! And it looks very elegant!Update!Still working just as well as the day I bought it!Worth every penny!😃😃😃

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THIS THING ROCKS!
reviewText: I love my new MacBook Pro. Coming from a lifelong Windows guy, that’s saying something. I’ve been a Windows tech/support person (retired) for over 25 years. Over that time, I’ve had very little interaction with the Mac OS. I’ve known for years that the Mac OS is a better, more secure and more robust OS, but that didn’t mean I wanted a Mac. Well, that recently changed. I took on a part time job doing support for a Linux NAS server, and an office full of Macs. To support the Mac users, I needed to fully understand the Mac OS. This brings us here.TO THE POINTDo not listen to the negative reviews for these “Renewed” MacBook Pros. My MacBook Pro arrived in perfect condition. Everything checked out like a brand new computer. It did have 50 charges on the battery, so someone did use the computer, and for some time. You could not tell by looking at the unit. I will also add that these computers are supposed to come with a fresh OS install. Mine did have residue from the previous owner, so I’m guessing they don’t always give you a clean install of the OS. That being said, if you get a Mac that doesn’t meet your expectation’s, just send it back. My plan was to give it a try. If after three attempts, I didn’t get a “good” one, I would give up. I didn’t need to do that. I was very happy with the first one I received. You can’t beat the price!To buyers coming from a Windows OS to the Mac OS. When I ordered my new Mac, a friend of mine (who has been a Mac tech longer than most people reading this right now have been alive) told me “don’t bring your Windows mind to the Mac”. This is so true. Don’t start by loading up your new Mac with Microsoft apps etc. Try Apple Pages, or LibreOffice (free download). Give the Mac way a chance. Forget about right click. Yeah, Mac has the Control click to show the context menu, but you will not see the Windows type options for creating a new document etc. Instead, open the app, create your document and then save it. It’s just a different way of doing things, but give it a chance before complaining about the way the Mac OS does it.That’s all. Enjoy your new Mac and have some fun…

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For the money you can't beat it.
reviewText: I've had this for a week now, and I'm going to try to do my best to give a thorough review.Pros:- It came in great, impeccable condition, really, with the right charger and everything.- Awesome battery life- Comfortable keyboard- Easy to navigate (I used to have a decent windows HP but it got destroyed due to a water accident, so I wanted something cheap that works, primarily for creative writing. I have limited experience with Chromebooks, but this has been super easy to learn)- Even though this Chrombook comes on it's last update (see Cons), there are still plenty of helpful add-ons to be downloaded from the Play Store. For example, the voice recorder I downloaded (and internal mic of the chromebook) produces better sound quality than my moderately expensive HP- I like the sleek, all black design- It doesn't run hot or loudCons:- Wifi detection can be pretty weak, so make sure you have access to a strong wifi connection- Headphone jack seems to be a little worn out, so sometimes depending on how I move the chord, the sound quality in my headphones changes (this is probably a problem that is exclusive to my chromebook)- It is a tad slower overall than middle to high end laptops, but not unbearable- Since Chrome is on it's last update, you can't download crucial extensions like Adblock.Overall, for 62 dollars or something after taxes, this is an amazing laptop. Frankly, I love it, and all the cons are not deal breakers at all. I guess it also comes down to the quality of the individual Chromebook that is shipped to you, as I suspect some are in better condition than others, but if Amazon's inspection process has improved, then I would think that the odds of getting a dud are less and less.Bottom line: If you want a laptop that's good and cheap, this is perfect for browsing, watching videos, writing. It's a tad slower than your higher end laptops, but oh well. It's fantastic, really.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Arrived Damaged & Out Of Date
reviewText: This one is going back! I needed an inexpensive Chromebook for a Ham Radio project and I like Dell so this seemed like a good deal. It is a low end Chromebook so I expected it to be slow and have low storage capacity. Both of those are true and I was willing to work around them. I normally steer clear of "refurbished" equipment unless I am very familiar with the seller but I took a chance on this one.What I didn't expect is that it would arrived damaged. Please look at the photos. At one point it had been dropped hard on the right rear corner so who knows what other internal damage still exists. (That's why I got the extended warranty.) It was shipped in bubble wrap in a plastic envelope so I don't know if the damage occurred during shipment or if it was sent that way. The box I sent it back it offers VASTLY more protection than the envelope the seller shipped it in.But it still worked so I was willing to live with it until I attempted to install some Android software from the Google Play Store. I can't! Seems this laptop is so out of date that it hasn't been eligible for updates since September 2021. As a result I cannot load anything from the play store and almost two years of security and system updates cannot be loaded. I didn't see anything in the description that warned about this so I am returning the laptop for a refund.The description reads "This product is in "Excellent condition". The screen and body show no signs of cosmetic damage visible from 12 inches away." Look at the photos: you can see that damage from 12 FEET away. And, naturally, I have to pay return postage which will be about half what I paid for it.Beware when you see a computer "deal" on Amazon that features a "renewed" product unless security and functionality is unimportant to you. This seller, "Tech Magnet" is now on my permanent "NEVER AGAIN" list of sellers on Amazon.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Wont boot up. Really unprofesional refurbished work
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I bought this laptop on May 30th 2024, it had some signs of use but I would say its normal for a refurbished product. The laptop worked fine until Sept 15th 2024 when it was not booting up. I tried a few things but the only sign was that Caps lock was flashing 6 times. When I decided to to see whats inside, I noticed that the Memory RAM is glued to the motherboard with silicon. I am still trying to figure out how to fix it but quality of the refurbished work is very bad, and definitely it seems that they just do minor repairs to re-sale those laptops without really solving the root cause of the problems. More updates to come..

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars No Customer Service. Bad Windows install.
reviewText: I really like this computer, but it took me awhile. I couldn't get programs to install. No way to contact customer service, so I called Amazon. They tried, but couldn't do anything for me. They suggested I call HP. HP said that I needed to register my Windows 10. They gave me a way to try to find out the product key, which didn't work. So I tried their 2nd choice of reinstalling a new version of Windows 10 for free. That worked. Now I have been able to install several programs, including MS Office, with no problems. All that took up 3 days of my time, but it's over now and I'm extremely happy with the computer. But not with the lack of customer service.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on January 9, 2024
reviewTitle: Fantastic Laptop
reviewText: Great machine, powerful icore7, and in excellent condition as advertised (Amazon Renewed). I'd recommend the HP Elitebook series for both personal and business use. Also, I did my research with this purchase (about 4 weeks) and it paid off: 1. Definitely stick to Amazon Renewed if you're looking for electronics (my opinion). 2. Always go with Prime for delivery as you can count on a speedy/secure arrival. 3. Take your time, dig into the reviews for third party sellers if you're going that route - as the more you dig, the more commonalities you'll discover (good or bad).

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Pristine! Fast Shipping!
reviewText: I must say, I’m pleasantly surprised. This MacBook was in perfect condition and looks amazing. It was packaged appropriately. The charger is not quality but you can find a Walmart brand100 watt charger for under $30. I am not worried about the charger, and if I was, it would most definitely be cancelled out by how pristine this MacBook is. I had the item shipped to a UPS Access Point and it took a couple days longer but it was expected. What really surprised me is that it was shipped on a Tuesday and made it across the country in a day. In researching the cost of shipping something this size overnight, I was shocked at how much this company paid to make sure I got it by the quoted shipping date. The battery health is 88%, which again I was pleasantly surprised. I also love how much faster this M1 chip MacBook is versus my Early 2020 MacBook with Intel. It’s like night and day. Another highlight is that I basically live on my MacBook with work and I loved how fast it charged and how much usage I got out of 1 single charge. It beats having to always plan where I’m going to charge my laptop (airport, plane, car, etc.). As with any MacBook, the ease and speed at which I could jump from window to window was crazy fast. I don’t know how this company makes any money because of how pristine the MacBook looks along with them overnighting it to me to make the quoted shipping date. Regardless, thank you so much Platinum Deals via Amazon, I hope to do business with you again!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very fast
reviewText: My last Macbook Air 2011 is still running well after 13 years, but I needed an upgrade as well. The M1 chip on my new 2020 is super fast, and the new machine is a little smaller, with same screen size and larger keyboard buttons placed a little closer together for faster typing. Came in perfect condition with charger. A great price, if you don't need the latest and greatest, and is more than adequate.

reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Multiple damaged/defective computers
reviewText: Please do not buy from this company! My first Macbook that was received was defective, as it would not charge despite using 5+ different charging methods (including the one I was given). They graciously sent me another computer; however, completely forgot to send the charger alongside it. On top of this, they sent me yet another defective computer that did not hold charge well, had a glitch in the screen, and issues with the “e” and “w” key. After trying to reach out to them for over a week, they have yet to respond to me. Do not buy from this company if you are looking for a quality computer.

After that, you can buy a new one or update manually. The screen is large and the font is adjustable. The sound quality is passable for those who just want to hear the audio and are not an audio expert. The keyboard is off center, so a lot of folks may need to adjust their finger/hand placement when typing. Otherwise, this is a great deal.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looks brand new
reviewText: I purchased this product to replace another Dell laptop that had failed after 2 years (I think that it was a surge issue). Anyway, that left me wondering about buying another brand new computer or going the renewed route. I decided on Olive Computers because the price was right. I am glad I did. The laptop arrived in a well packaged unit. I plugged it in and xferred the files from my old laptop using a SSD enclosure. In less than an hour I was up and running as though the old Dell never crashed. Very happy with this product. If I had one complaint it would be that the warranty registration that was enclosed does not work, I have tried multiple times to register for the warranty and it always responds with a server error.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Mexico on August 26, 2024
reviewTitle: Buen producto y servicio al cliente.
reviewText: Empaquetado: LLego en buen estado, sin rayones, ni golpes, como nueva. Muy bien empaquetado, con unas burbujas lo suficientemente gruesas y infladas para evitar danos (teclado en ingles.)Experiencia inicial: por el momento no podria hablar a largo plazo y mi punto de vista es de alguien inexperto en portatiles, pero aqui mi experiencia en mis primeros dias.Descripcion: La laptop cumple con la descripcion, cpu, windows 10, Gb, cargador y velocidad, es rapida. Actualmente conseguir una laptop asi saldria arriba de 10mil MXN, por lo que considero que esta bien para el precio.Bateria: es buena, aun que depende mas de la funcion que ocupes y el tiempo que la necesites encendida, para lo basico esta bien, solo no la uses mientras carga en algo que pueda pesarle.Pantalla: yo la veo bien, sin rayones y en cuanto a calidad creo que es suficiente, siempre se puede configurar o mejorar pero realmente no suelo ser exigente con ello.Funcion: Por el momento esta bien, es rapida lo que es una gran ventaja, reamente no tarda casi nada al encender o al empezar a usarla despues de encender, no deja esperando nisiquiera segundos. Funcional en juegos no tan pesados. Comoda para trasportar fuera o dentro de tu casa, no hace ruido al calentarse, a menos que se caliente mucho pero sigue siendo leve, de igual forma comprare su enfriador pero para lo basico no se siente nada. Pronto comenzare mis estudios por lo que mas adelante editare mi opinion despues de un tiempo.Camara y microfono: no me e permitido usar la camara o microfono con gran detalle pero lo que vi fue que realmente no estaba mal, tampoco digo que sea muy bueno, tampoco suelo ser muy exigente en este aspecto, pero se distingue tu imagen y tu voz, eso para mi ya es aceptable, pero hay que recalcar que son funciones que no necesitare por lo que para mi esta bien si es visible, asi que si eres alguien que lo necesita siempre puedes investigar mas sobre esto (lo mismo digo respecto a la pantalla.)Detalles: Me gusta la luz del teclado, tambien es comodo y el talk pad me es funcional, al recibirlo, tarde en darme cuenta de una ligera falla en el teclado, no fue un gran problema pues recibi la ayuda necesaria del vendedor y ahora esta al 100%, no tuve un gran problema en la configuracion inicial.Servicio: Yo realice el pedido y me llego el mismo dia que lo compre con la ayuda prime de amazon, mi pedido decia que llegaria antes de 8pm y llego horas antes por lo que diria que el envio es bueno y cumplido en cuanto a la aproximacion de entrega, la persona encargada de entregarme el paquete cumplio con las medidas de seguridad como el nombre y codigo para entregarmelo y la caja del paquete llego en buen estado, sin golpes ni detalles con la cinta.Vendedor: Contacte con el vendedor por el detalle del teclado, fue amable y rapido, lo contacte en horas nocturnas, yo eperaba que me respondieran al dia siguiente pero fue en esas mismas horas, me entrego instrucciones y fue abierto en cuanto a su ayuda. Anteriormente ya lo habia contactado para preguntar por otro portatil (no tuve ningun problema.) Y me contesto igual de rapido y eficiente, para mi su servicio fue bueno/excelente, no podria hablar sobre su servicio en cuanto a devoluciones o cambios y eso ya es algo bueno, no dudo que si tuviera mas problemas o necesitara una devolucion me atenderia de igual forma.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great alternative to iPads
reviewText: Nearly the same functionality of an iPad but at a fraction of the price. Battery last very long. But don't be confused. This does not have the power of a laptop especially for games. Resource intensive games will not work great on this but casual online games will. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a great device could not be happier
reviewText: I've always been a Windows guy for PCs since Windows 3.0. Can you imagine that? And always Android since my first Motorola back in the day. This is my first dive into a Chromebook which I have been tempted to try for some time. I had been concerned about performance and the learning curve but a reason came up to give it a try.I have two notebooks, one Dell and one HP, the later for remote working, the other for personal use, finance, volunteer work etc, etc. Also have a kindle fire, a Samsung Tab 4, two Paperwhites, and a Pixel 6. Rest of the family is on iPhone and Macs, not me.Why would I need another device? Well I've started to pursue a side gig career as a freelance writer. So I wanted a device totally seperate from work and other life digital activities. I wanted a tool that was only for writing. I chose this device and am so happy. Beautiful design, fast, clear, great wide keyboard, which is important as I have big hands. The screen is great visually and good for touch, backlit keyboard for middle of the night work. So easy to setup, all my Google stuff came over easily.All in all very happy with this device and I really like the Chrome OS experience, nice to get away from Windows for awhile.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Big Mistake - Very Poor Performance, slow, sluggish.
reviewText: If I could give this tank zero stars, I would. The biggest mistake or misstep, whatever you want to call it, was buying a Chromebook with only 4Gb of RAM. The Ryzen 3, whatever specs it has, is completely throttled by the lousy RAM. By the time you finish waiting for a page to load (if you have more than 3 tabs open), you'll be ready to go live in a nursing home. I don't know if 8 Gb of RAM would have mitigated this issue, but good God is this thing slow.Don't buy it. There are far better options out there at this price point. There are only two positive things that can be said about this wheezing tank. The screen is nice, and it better be because about the only thing you'll be doing on this monstrosity is watching movies on Netflix or checking your email. Second, it really is built like a tank. Heavy and solid, so when you finally get tired of waiting for a tab to load and fling it across the room, it won't break, whether you want it to or not.Those users giving this barely usable hunk of metal 5 stars can't be using it to actually get anything done. Too many 5 star reviews for this awful Chromebook to be believable.Update: 3 tabs open and it takes nearly 15 seconds just to close a tab and another 10 seconds to open a new one. Powerwash barely helps. Using this thing feels like a punishment from God.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent
reviewText: Bought this to take to work to use and get school work done. Slow at times but, does what I need it to do for what it’s worth.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One fine Chromebook. It is a bit heavier than I expected, but, for my use, it works out just fine.
reviewText: Really nothing to say that I dislike about the CBook. I've owned a number of them before. As I mentioned in the headline, the weight is heavier than I expected, but I don't carry it around all day. It does seem to "hang up" when I am on some sites, but that appears to be the site loading Adv. after Adv. while I am trying to read something. I am going to add an Ad-blocker to cut that delay back. It's a shame the advertisers are killing the golden goose(geese) by over-loading every page with more and more interruptions. The CBook is great for me.

If looking for a upgradeable chromebook on Amazon, Id suggest this, if NEED s touchscreen. Battery life is insane, for something so small, and powerful.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Choice for College
reviewText: I recently purchased this laptop and it has been perfect for what I need it for. I was searching for a budget-friendly, nice laptop for college that I could do light gaming on (Roblox, Minecraft, sims, etc.). This was a good choice for that! It is also light enough and compact enough to fit in a backpack, small tote bag, etc.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent 14" Chromebook
reviewText: Very impressed with this Chromebook. This is a rocket ship compared to the old 11.5" Asus Chromebook I had previously. Bright, crisp HD graphics, fast performance with its upgraded 13th Gen i5 Intel CPU and fast SSD makes this thing sing. Love the Gorilla Glass screen, makes for nice super smooth scrolling on the responsive touch-screen. The games I've played so far run buttery smooth. Also love the back-lit keyboard for when I'm using it in low-light conditions. For a smaller Chromebook like this, the upgraded DTS audio sounds great. And one thing that I wish all notebooks had is the fact that it has TWO Thunderbolt 4 compatible USB-C ports, ONE ON EACH SIDE, so whichever side is most convenient for you to use for charging, etc., its got you covered. A thoughtful touch. And the fact it came with its own nice padded sleeve is just icing on the cake. Yes, this Acer Chromebook is more expensive then most other 14" Chromebooks but with all its features I found it to be easily worth every penny. Nice work Acer!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Satisfied overall but lacks fit/finish of Pixelbook
reviewText: I bought this to replace my not-so-old Pixelbook which was succumbing to a swelling battery and no means to replace it (Thanks Google :-( ). Speed of the Acer is on par with the Pixelbook but the feel of the keyboard keys, the finish of the bezels, the screen quality and speakers don't measure up to the pixelbook. Still, I'm pleased with the purchase. By comparison with my wife's Dell XPS-13/i7, this Acer chromebook is much faster and more stable. For my laptop needs I'll take Chrome OS over Windows any day.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Little Warrior with strong punch!
reviewText: **UPDATE** 22-7-2024: KEYBOARD letter "O" malfunction. From day 1 I noticed an extreme sensitivity of the letter. One slight touch added 5 additional O's (ooooo). I thought I could manage, but after nearly 25 days, it began to interfere with my work. I reached out to Amazon and was impressed with the level of support I was provided. Initially we reinstalled the keyboard driver, but unfortunately, I had to go with a replacement. Luckily, these days almost every thing I do is backed up to a cloud and so I won't have to reinstall much. Hope this helps others out there.**Original REVIEW**Recently purchased the Koolsmile 8-inch laptop, specifically the Mini Laptop with an HD Touch Screen running Windows 11 Pro, powered by the Intel N100 4 Cores processor, featuring 12GB LPDDR5 RAM and a 1TB M.2 SSD.This little warrior has proven to be a robust and reliable companion, ideal for on-the-go use.Compact and Portable:Despite its compact size, the Koolsmile 8-inch laptop packs a punch. Its lightweight and portable design makes it a perfect travel companion for both work and pleasure. It fits easily into a bag, allowing for convenient access wherever you go.Performance and Versatility:Equipped with an Intel N100 4 Cores processor, 12GB of LPDDR5 RAM, and a 1TB M.2 SSD, this mini laptop delivers impressive performance for its size. It's perfect for checking emails, creating documents in Word and Excel, drafting presentations in PowerPoint, and transporting documents. However, it's important to note that this device is not designed for gaming. If gaming is a priority, potential buyers should review the specs carefully.Touch Screen and Stylus Pen:One of the standout features of the Koolsmile 8-inch laptop is its responsive HD touch screen. The touch functionality is on point, especially when using the stylus pen that comes with the laptop. I find it incredibly useful for taking handwritten notes in OneNote and highlighting sections of documents when editing. This feature adds a layer of convenience and precision that enhances productivity.Battery Life and Charging:The battery life of the Koolsmile 8-inch laptop is impressive, lasting around 6 hours, which is well enough to get me through the day. The small charger is easily portable, making it convenient to carry along. However, it does take some time to reach a full charge, which is to be expected.Connectivity and Additional Features:The Koolsmile 8-inch laptop boasts modern connectivity options, including Gigabit Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.2, and HDMI. These features ensure seamless integration with other devices and networks. However, while the built-in 2MP camera is functional, it may not meet the quality requirements for professional meetings and presentations. For better video quality, I recommend purchasing a separate small camera, such as one from Logitech's range.Accessories for Enhanced Use:For those with larger hands or a preference for full-sized keyboards, a small Bluetooth mouse and keyboard can enhance the overall experience. These accessories complement the mini laptop, making it easier to use for extended periods.Final Thoughts:Overall, the Koolsmile 8-inch laptop is an excellent choice for those seeking a portable and efficient device for travel. It's not meant to replace a primary device but serves as a perfect secondary tool for productivity on the go. With its impressive specs, versatile touch screen, stylus pen, and reliable battery life, it is highly recommended for professionals who need a reliable and compact laptop for everyday tasks.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent balance of performance, design, and functionality
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The Koosmile Mini Laptop is a compact powerhouse that impresses with its portability and performance. Weighing just 0.78kg and featuring an 8.0-inch screen, it’s perfect for anyone on the move—whether you’re a business professional, student, or even a gamer. The 180° rotatable flip screen is a standout feature, allowing the device to convert into a tablet easily. The touchscreen is responsive and supports handwriting input, making it a versatile tool for notes, sketches, or presentations.Despite its small size, this mini laptop delivers excellent performance. It has 12GB LPDDR5 memory and a 1TB M.2 SSD, ensuring quick data processing and ample storage. The Intel N100 processor (4 cores, up to 3.4GHz) powers through everyday tasks and more demanding applications. Whether multitasking between documents or enjoying light gaming, this device handles it smoothly.The CNC-crafted whole metal body adds a premium feel, and its durable build gives you confidence in its longevity. Multiple ports—USB 3.0, USB Type-C, HDMI, and a headphone jack—enhance its versatility. Connectivity is seamless, with Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.2, and Gigabit Ethernet providing fast, stable networking options.The 1280x800 resolution screen delivers sharp visuals, and with 1024-level pressure sensitivity, the handwriting input is precise and enjoyable. Battery life could be better at 3-5 hours, but it’s reasonable considering the compact size. It’s an excellent option for short bursts of work or play on the go.For those who need a portable yet powerful device, the Ultra Pocket PC offers an excellent balance of performance, design, and functionality in a small package.
