reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars There is a flaw in this product.
reviewText: There is a flaw in this product because when it was being charged I touched the side and shorted out. The screen went dark and the charging light went out and stopped working.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on November 17, 2024
reviewTitle: Super Portable
reviewText: This 8-inch 2-in-1 mini laptop is a powerhouse in a compact form! With 12GB RAM, 1TB SSD, and an Intel N100 processor, it handles multitasking with ease. The 6-hour battery life is impressive for its size, and the package includes plenty of accessories, adding great value. Perfect for on-the-go productivity with Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.2, and HDMI support. Highly recommended for students or travelers!

reviewDate: Reviewed in Japan on November 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 今の時代、誰が買ってもおかしくないのかも
reviewText: このUMPC(ウルトラモバイルパソコン)は、外出先や移動中の狭いスペースでも快適に操作できるサイズ感と、日常使いからビジネスまで役に立つ充分なスペックとを、ちょうど良く両立させていると感じました。私のように、今までパソコンはほとんどデスクトップを使ってきたモバイルデバイス初心者の方や、私の母のようにパソコンに触ったこともない、ご高齢の方などにも意外と良いのかもとも思いました。ポートはType-CにHDMIポート、USB 3.0(4ポートハブも付属)がそろっているので、他の周辺機器などとの接続もスムーズです。カメラ、マイク、デュアルスピーカーも内蔵。ビデオ通話も本機のみで始められます。オンライン会議や配信などでよりクリアな音声が必要であれば、3.5mmオーディオジャックもあるのでヘッドホンも使えます。インターネットは、Wi-Fi 6やBluetooth 5.2に対応しており無線でもよいですし、さらに背面にはLANケーブルポートもあるので、初心者にも分かりやすく安定な有線でのインターネットも可能です。CPUは省電力に強いIntel N100プロセッサ、バッテリーも連続3～5時間の使用に適しており、これでも充分かもしれませんが、さらに長時間連続使用する際には、モバイルバッテリーも併用すると良いと思います。充電スペックは30Wです。●ノートスタイルの実用性7mm四方のタッチパッドが搭載されていますが、さすがにこのサイズだと使いづらく感じました。クリックも可能ではありますが操作が難しく、スライドと誤認識されることも少なくありませんでした。そのため、小さなワイヤレスマウスなどを使うか、せっかくですので本機のみで活用するには、内蔵キーボードを使うのがおすすめだと思いました。キーボードの「PgUp」や「PgDn」で上下のスクロール操作、左右クリックはパッドの左下と右下のボタンです。また、もちろん画面に直接触れてのタッチパネルによるスクロールも、とても快適です。出先でも本機とスマホだけでWindows 11にタッチパネルと、ここまで快適にパソコン作業が出来るのは本当に凄いの一言です。●タブレットスタイルの活用私のような初心者には少し慣れが必要ですが、タッチペンによる入力が可能です。そして画面上に表示できるソフトウェアキーボードも活用できるため、個人的にはまずはこちらからが使いやすく感じています。状況に応じてタッチペンや画面キーボードを選べるので、慣れるにしたがってどんどん便利に手軽に操作していけそうです。また、一般的なタブレットの重さに慣れている方やご高齢の方にとっては、約0.78kgとはいえ、長時間持って使っていると手が疲れてくる重さかもしれません。●総合的な使い勝手持ち運びがしやすく、必要な機能がしっかり備わっており、使えば使うほど驚きの連続です。自宅や職場のPCモニターもついタッチスクロールしたくなるほど、特に私はこのタッチパネルの快適さを実感しています。キーボードは日本語キーボードですので、まったくパソコンの初心者の方や、ご高齢の方にとっても良い選択肢なのかもしれませんよ。以上、ご参考になりましたら幸いです。

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on November 24, 2024
reviewTitle: Exactly What I needed
reviewText: So, here is the thing. I am a consultant, I need to meet people at odd places at times. sometimes even do a presentation. This mini laptop does the trick for me. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Refurbed?! Excellent Condition!! Scam!!
reviewText: This was a complete FAILURE on Global Certified Authentic's part.When the product arrived at my door I was highly excited to open it and package it as a gift to my son who is an over the road driver.When I opened the product and inspected the unit I was disappointed to find the following:The casing had a deep scratch on the bottom of the unit. Multiple others all over the device.The charging port was completely useless. It looked as if there was a broken charger snapped off inside the port. The unit would not even turn on.Upon receiving the replacement unit and charging cable, the power supply did not have the proper wattage to charge the device.Again, disappointing 😞 .I contacted the company yet again concerning this issue. I was advised that they no longer had any chargers for the unit in stock and that a refund of only $15 would be provided. Would you please locate me an OEM Dell charger for this device for $15.Well, let me tell you something. The charger that was shipped with the only working unit on the first order which is what was needed for the second cost much more than the amount that was offered as a refund.The product description said excellent condition. These devices are to go through a rigorous refurbishment process to check them for faults to see what has to be replaced or repaired. Failure on Global Certified Authentic's part.Two orders and two failures. I will never recommend this company to anyone and will steer clear in the future.Amazon should delist them until they get there act together.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars You get what you pay for, but they still lied
reviewText: The chromebook works just fine and the specs are the same or better than advertised, but it is very clearly not a 2021 model. It is actually a Dell 11.6" Chromebook 11 3189 from 2018, and I have no idea why thy lied about it, I still would have bought it. I just wanted a cheap Chromebook to watch videos on, with and HDMI port, and that's what I got, but the deceit just really rubs me the wrong way. The condition of mine is pretty good but certainly not excellent. There is a small imperfection in the display, and the battery shows as 78% health. Both of which I would have expected to be fixed on a truly refurbished product. Additionally the laptop is no longer supported and will not receive updates from google any more, which is also pretty suspect considering its supposed to be 2021 model. Overall I got what I wanted, but I would recommend buying something different given the dishonesty of the description in terms of quality and the actual product.Update: The battery completely died within 3 weeks of purchase. I requested a replacement and they send me another one with 78% battery health out of the box, and it is a 2017!!! Even older than the last one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Lasted me about 4-5 months. Not happy.
reviewText: I bought this computer, needing it for school work, and was a cheap option for someone who didn’t have a big budget. It worked okay for about 4 months, had some issues such as the battery dying very fast and overheating a lot. Learned to live with it and only keep a few tabs open. Eventually, it stopped working, and wouldn’t let me do anything on the computer since the wifi wouldn’t enable. Took it to a repair place, turns out the motherboard was dying the whole time and didn’t have long left. Extremely upset that I spent 333 dollars on this product and Amazon won’t refund me or do anything at all since its about 1 month and a half past the return date. Which I understand, but obviously they need to have exceptions or make the return dates on these longer since they are CLAIMING that these are in “excellent condition” When they are on the brink of dying. Very unhappy that there has not been any problem solving on Amazon’s side. And if you buy one, if ANYTHING seems off immediately return the product because it will probably stop working justttt after the return date so they can short you a couple hundred of dollars! And what’s even better is that in order for them to fix my computer it would cost over 900 dollars…. When I payed over 300 dollars to get it in the first place. I would’ve been better off buying a brand new macbook then this crap :) Atleast it would have lasted me A LOT longer. It also came with a horrible covering on it that wasn’t even centered on the computer so I had to peel that off. I would like a refund or atleast half of my money back since this thing didn’t even last me half of a year. Waste of 300 dollars that goes to this stupid company.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected
reviewText: This MacBook is honestly very good and I’m impressed. It’s in great condition but it did come dirty and I just cleaned it and everything is fine. I do have concerns about the battery life, maybe it’s because of the game I was playing or something but it went from 100% to 78% in less than 15 minutes. Another thing is the “i” key on the keyboard is a bit stuck and it types out twice like this “ii” but that really about it, everything else is great. This is my first MacBook and i was honestly scared of getting a cheap laptop because every time i did it couldn’t run the simple stuff that i wanted it to do. This MacBook can handle basic gaming like Roblox and Minecraft. It went through so smoothly. Another thing is when I’m searching the web and try to go to a website, it doesn’t pop up it’s like it’s loading but it’s not. It isn’t with all the websites i look up but it’s with just some of them. Overall a great laptop I recommend!Edit: I think I’m going to bring this rating to a 4. Firstly, I forgot to mention the sound quality, it’s amazing honestly I can have the volume up about three to four notches and it dang near sounds like I’m in a movie theater, but the thing is I’m bringing this down to a 4 because this laptop is pretty old and doesn’t support a lot of things like I can’t even watch Netflix from off this laptop and I don’t even know how to access so many things on here. The App Store is stupid I’m trying to look up how to navigate everything because maybe that’s my problem but I don’t even know what year this thing is let alone know how to find out the year so it’s hard because if I just look up “MacBook Pro” YouTube thinks I’m talking about one of the newer ones. Like I said before this is a pretty good laptop but it’s so outdated and I can barely get any games on here. Like I got steam the other day but steam barely even have fun games that supports macOS. (Just in case anybody wanted to know about downloading steam). This is my review on this laptop.

reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Go ahead and skip this if you're looking for quality
reviewText: I purchased this after seeing an embroidery digitizer use it in a video online. One of the well-known digitizing software companies even recommends it on its site. While the reviews online seem to vary, I figured at this price it was worth a shot.It arrived quickly. The packaging is okay, though if it had been included in a box with something heavy, I would have concerns about it being protected well enough.The instructions it came with were insufficient at best. They basically say to insert a battery, plug in the dongle to your computer, and the pen will automatically connect as it was paired at the factory. There are no markings on the inside of the pen or in the instructions to tell you which direction to insert the battery.Despite our technical knowledge, neither my husband nor I were able to get this pen to connect to any computer in our household. The wireless mouse I purchased the same day worked just fine though, so that leads me to believe it was a problem with the pen.Holding the pen felt unnatural to me. It's oddly shaped, probably for ergonomics, but it fails in this way.Perhaps others have had better luck, but this is going back and I'll have to do further research on a digital pen.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Premium feel and feature packed
reviewText: I got this mouse to switch between 3 machines. I've been using the ProtoArc keyboard for about 6 months and like it a lot. Now my workflow is more complicated and being able to switch without changing peripheral devices is a huge upgrade. Fortunately everything else about this mouse works well for my preferences. The angle option is nice. I use the 20 degree tilt. (Note to ProtoArc: it would be nice if you could lock it at 20 degrees.) It's a very comfortable angle and the button placement is fine for my hand (medium-large). The trackball is smooth and the DPI options are easy to change for various tasks. Clicks are silent yet definite. The surfaces are pleasing and do not seem like they'll collect grime. Everything feels well planned both ergonomically and for producrivity.I have two minor complaints: 1) [UPDATE 6/10/24: I may not have given this mouse a complete charge when I first got it. It's lasting me 5 or 6 days of heavy use now.] The battery life is short. It got me thru a very full workday—about 8 hours of actual use time. The next morning it died after about an hour. Easy to charge at my desk, but if ProtoArc could double or triple the battery life then it would match other brands in longevity. 2) A quiker wakeup and reconnect would be nice. It's not bad. And with the capability to connect with three devices it's hard to complain. But if ProtoArc can solve these 2 issues I think they could take over a big chunk of the peripheral market. Even with these minor criticisms I will confidently rate this mouse and the matching keyboard as 5 star devices. ProtoArc is a company on the rise.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replace your old trackball with this one or just make the switch from a mouse
reviewText: I ordered it, I plugged the little USB dongle in, turned it on and it worked right out of the box. I was astonished. Not that it worked, but that it was so much better than my previous trackball. It's so slick and precise and the smooth button clicks made my old trackball seem like a brick dipped in glue.I prefer trackballs to mice and most are pretty similar ergonomically, but they managed to improve on that with the tilt feature. Most trackballs appear to be the same, but this one is hands down above the rest. I may or may not use the feature, but I can definitely see the benefit of it being able to switch between three different computers, using the wireless for one and Bluetooth for the other two. The button for switching between computers seems like it is in an odd place and vulnerable to unintentional clicking, but that's not the case. It's conveniently located without being in the way. Being able to adjust DPI at the touch of a button is pretty handy too, allowing for increased precision when required. This button is also conveniently located without the potential of accidentally changing the setting. The RGB lighting is a cool feature with a number of pattern options, but really has no functional purpose that I'm aware of. I'm happy with cool though. The lights will shut off automatically after about 30 seconds of non use in order to save power. Of course, it comes with a charging cable. What more is there to say? Oh, yeah, I even like that textured surface under your palm. This one's a winner!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent for the price.
reviewText: Bought this after Logitech MS Ergo crapped out after 2 years so I can only really compare to the.The cheaper price was nice. The 3rd device is a handy option if you need it. The ball movement isn't as smooth but not far enough off to be much of a factor. The covering is slippery, sometimes I feel like it's going to slip away, the Logitech had actual grip to it. Battery life is about half. Often lags when switching between devices. The plastic base has me afraid I might accidentally snap, feels half as sturdy as the Logitech.Works well enough for the price, though if this craps out in the same amount of time as the Logitech then I'll probably shell out the little extra for the MX.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Off-brand but On-Point!
reviewText: My wife and I have both been using the Logitech M570 trackball (and it's various ancestors) for decades. Each and every single one would typically last approximately 2.5-3 years, at which point the left mouse button would begin to add in random additional clicks when used. This happened again, last week.Normally, I avoid off-brand products like the plague. I have rarely had even acceptable experiences with them - generally, the experiences were terrible. Amazon's return policy, however, offers me a bit of flexibility when it comes to product selection. With this in mind, when I happened to see this item, sporting a 20% discount (bringing the price down to $39.99), I figured, "Why not?" I am SO glad I did!This trackball is excellent! Construction, battery life (so far), setup - all were exemplary. If you are in the market for a new/replacement trackball, I highly recommend you give this one a shot. You will be pleasantly surprised.Pros:Quality construction - the plastic feels solid and the trackball as a whole has a nice "heft" to it.No extraneous software needed - the trackball works as a plug and play mouse. The RGB ring around the ball is controlled via a 5-setting push-button (4 color patterns + Off).Rechargeable built-in battery (USB-C) - No scouring the junk drawer for AA or AAA batteries.Battery Life - I've been using mine heavily for four days and still have 43% charge remaining.Connectivity - This trackball can be connected to a max of three devices at a time; one via the (included) 2.4 GHz receiver and two via Bluetooth. Switch between devices with the touch of a button.Comfort - trackball can be used in a flat position or at a 20-ish degree tilt to the right.CONS:No direct control of the RGB ring: there are 4 color patterns and off - that's it. While this doesn't bother me, it may be an issue for some users.The scroll wheel has a very tight, crisp movement between clicks. I find this perfect, my wife does not.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, but cheap feel
reviewText: This review is for the Adesso iMouse S8. I was looking for the smallest wired mouse that still has a DPI switch button. I believe this is one of the only mice that fits into that category.The Adesso S8 is a small and light weight mouse with a retractable cord. It is very comfortable to use with my medium sized hands. I used a much smaller Verbatim Traveler mouse and it was just too difficult to control. I did notice less strain on my wrists and elbows with this mouse over other much larger mice that I have used in the past. However, this is a benefit based on the size class as opposed to this mouse in particular. I do have a few issues with the Adesso S8.The main problem I have with the Adesso S8 is the build quality. The Adesso is light because it is made out of very thin plastic with the inside having a lot of empty space. The retractable cord is thinner than any mouse cord that I have ever seen or used before. That might be acceptable if retracting the cord was not so tricky. Even the buttons and scroll wheel have that cheap feel to it. Some more metal or thicker plastic would have improved build quality and added some much needed heft to it. For me, the light weight makes it a bit difficult to control. Another thing is that I have seen other mice with a very similar design and look to this one. So, this is probably a generic mouse that Adesso just puts a name on.Overall, this is a comfortable mouse that actually has 4 DPI settings. I would prefer a mouse with a little more weight to it. I do not believe this mouse would last that long given its flimsy build quality. In the end the price does seem to match the quality of mouse that you get.Note: Amazon.com does not allow half ratings. But if I could I would give it 3.5 out of 5.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great keyboard from a company that stands behind their products
reviewText: ** quick update to my review: I expected to write this update a few weeks ago, when they batteries finally ran out, so I could comment on how long they lasted. Then another week passed without them running out. Then another. AND ANOTHER. I've used this keyboard for well over a month now (closer to 6 weeks, actually) and FINALLY this morning the lights started flashing to let me know it needed a charge. I'm extremely impressed with the life on this! I'm not using it for 8+ hours every day, but I did use it for at least 1-2 hours most days. Absolutely recommend this keyboard, no hesitation.I've been using an older, full-size Apple "Magic Keyboard" for the last 5+ years, which has given me quite a bit of "muscle memory" when it comes to typing. When my old keyboard finally died, I went looking for a replacement that was full sized, wireless, had the apple keyboard layout, and wouldn't cost me an arm and a leg. There's not actually all that many options that check all of those boxes, but I was fortunate enough to find this one.When it arrived, I tried absolutely everything I could think of to get it into pairing mode and just couldn't make it happen. I ended up reading through Macally's website and then calling their support department, and after walking through some troubleshooting with me they determined the bluetooth module was bad. Since I bought it on Amazon they said I could either return it here and order a new one, or process an RMA directly through them. The downside to doing it through them was that it "might take a bit longer to get to you" since they obviously don't have Amazon's logistics infrastructure, but they didn't require me to send it back to them either. I filled out a short RMA form via email, and a few days later my brand new keyboard arrived via UPS. I think it only ended up being one, maybe two days longer wait at most.Now, not only do I have a working keyboard again, they sent me the most recent model (USB-C charging instead of micro-usb) too! Pairing this new one took me all of 10 seconds, and it's been working great ever since.They keyboard doesn't feel "quite" as good as my old Apple keyboard, but the difference is negligible and absolutely not worth paying literally 3x more for. If my old keyboard was a 10, this is a solid 9.5. I'm entirely happy with it.I haven't used it long enough to comment on battery life or longevity yet, but given how easy it was to resolve a problem with them I'm not worried about either.I'd absolutely recommend this for anyone looking to replace a magic keyboard (or to avoid paying 3x the cost to buy one in the first place)!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good hardware held-back by poor software hacks
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The keyboard hardware is very well built, while it is made of plastic, the artificial weights inside it makes it feel premium. I also think the keypresses has a more premium feeling compared to Apple's keyboard. However, they put many software hacks on this keyboard to try to achieve the function row functionality, which causes the following problems:1. Pressing F5 does not start dictation, instead it brings up Spotlight, it is same as pressing F4 button.2. F6 key does not start Do Not Disturb on Mac, instead it puts Mac to sleep.3. The Fn key is not sending the Fn key event. I have the Fn key set to bring up Emoji panel, but pressing it only changes the input method for me.4. Pressing fn + F1, F2…etc does not input F1 F2..etc key press, instead it is still performing multimedia functions such as brightness & volume.Details of the software hacks of this keyboard:The Fn button is not sending the Fn key event, so I can't use the Fn key to bring up the emoji panel, instead it is sending a hardcoded Control + Space keypress event to switch input methods. Same for F3 and F4 keys, they sending hardcoded keyboard shortcuts (e.g. Command + Space) to bring up Spotlight or Mission Control, if you customized the keyboard shortcuts in MacOS, some of the function row keys will no longer work. Since the Fn key is programmed to send Control + Space keypresses, you can not input F1 to F12 by pressing Fn + the function row keys, so if you need to input F1 to F12, then you have to look for other keyboards.I really hope they can fix the software on this keyboard, I have one docking station and 2 MacBooks, I bought this keyboard so that I can use the 2.4Ghz adapter to connect this keyboard to my docking station, so I don't have to switch keyboards when switching between my 2 MacBooks on my docking station.Upon reaching out to the seller about the problems above, the seller is very apologetic and offered a refund, huge kudos to the excellent customer service!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal and just like new
reviewText: Was a little worried about buying refurb, but for the price of $70, I figured there wasn’t much to lose, especially since it could always be returned. The item arrived in “like new” condition. Packaging, accessories and the keyboard itself are all in clean, flawless condition. Fired up straight out of the box and connected immediately to my MacBook Pro and my iPad without any issue. As for the experiencing using the keyboard itself, this is my first mechanical keyboard and I find the typing experience to be pleasant. To be honest though, the novelty of the loud clicking (even though this is a “quiet” mechanical), while fun at first, began to wear off after about an hour. I started to experiment on how to strike the keys to make the strokes as quiet as possible. While switching back and forth between the MX Mechanical, MX Keys, and my MacBook Pro’s keyboard, I find I much prefer the scissor switches, but I will keep the mechanical around switch it up every now and then. If the MX Mechanical Mini is what you want, don’t hesitate on buying refurb and saying a lot of money. If the item you get doesn’t meet expectations, you can always send it back and try again.Edit - 3/9/24. After using the Mechanical Mini exclusively for a couple of days, I’m much more “used” to it, both he feel and the sound, and am starting to prefer it to the MX Keys. I still enjoy the built in keyboard on my MacBook Pro the most, but the mechanical mini is not far behind.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great keyboard. One oddity. UPDATE 5/27/2024
reviewText: I order this keyboard, but a bigger keyboard and a $100 logitech keyboard. This is smaller than I thought it would be, but that isn't really bad. Yes, it would be a little easier if there was a row of buttons for the shortcuts instead of requiring everything to be a combo or triple combo press. But, it works good, the keys have a nice feel, it is easy to type on and the keys are where you expect them to be. You can turn the light brightness up and down. Plus, it has fn-lock, and an fn-lock indicator light, so you can pick whether the shortcut keys (most the F1-F12 keys) act like function keys when pressed or the shortcut keys. It comes with a manual but the instructions are also printed on the bottom of the keyboard which is a nice touch. It's very similar to a laptop keyboard. But yeah, apart from it being a little finicky when you go to pair it the first time, it's a really great keyboard. I almost never use the number pad numbers, and if I did need them for some reason, like I was playing a game, I could just switch to a different keyboard. I really don't see how a Logitech keyboard can be worth 2 1/2 times the price of this one. Granted, the Logitech comes with a dongle and this doesn't so maybe that will be an issues, but you can get a Bluetooth receiver for $10. The Logitech keyboard also comes with special software that will let you map the short keys to different keystrokes in different applications, but most applications already support shortcut key mapping, and Open Source programs like AutoHotKey and TweakKey for windows also allow you to do this for free will 100% for more more and flexibility. But yeah, I'm super happy, can't really speak on the battery life, but hopefully it is good.UPDATE 5/26/24:I didn't notice when I bought the keyboard or even when I reviewed it, but this keyboard comes with Left and Right Windows keys and No Left Ctrl. You have left and right Alt keys, but not left and right control, and a Right Windows. This makes it hard to use Photoshop and Illustrator on Windows because Ctrl++ and Ctrl+- are the default commands for zoom in and out, and if you have to use the left Ctrl key it suddenly requires 2 hands.Thankfully, there are a couple solutions. The easiest is to download Microsoft's PowerToys for Windows and go to the keyboard manager and Enable Key Remapping and then remap that key to Ctrl(left). This I have working.UPDATE:You can use a program called KeyTweak to remap keys in the Windows 10 Registry. I ended up having to do this because the keyboard doesn't have a delete and backspace button. The delete button typically works as a backspace button. You can press fn+delete to have it work as a delete button, but I need an actual delete button like my laptop keyboard has. This is the layout the Logitech MX mini uses (it costs almost $100 though).I used a program called KeyTweak to remap the PrntScreen key to delete in the Windows registry. Unfortunately, this remaps BOTH the print screen key on this keyboard, and the print screen key on my laptop.So, I have to unmap everything. Restart my computer, then map fn+PrintScreen (my laptop's "Insert key") to PrintScreen. Then map PrintScreen to delete. Then remap Left Windows Key to Left Control. And now it works the way I want, except I have to press fn when I press PrintScreen on my laptop, and I no longer have an Insert key, but I literally haven't used an insert key in probably 20 years.The reason I dropped my review to 4 stars is because the wireless keyboard seems to sometimes send double keys, or it will go to sleep (even when plugged in), and then it will miss a key, and then I'll hit it again, and then it will double send the key it missed + the new key. It's literally 6 inches from my laptop, and I wanted to see if I shut off bluetooth and just used USB-C if it would still mess up, but you can't shut off bluetooth and just plug it in :( So I'm dropping my review to 4 stars, mostly for the buggy keys but also because it lacks the option to work as a non-wireless keyboard. If it just worked good, I wouldn't mind having to rebind the keys, but missing keys and losing keys while typing it a big PITA, especially because I code. It isn't mess up enough to really warrant sending it back, it's maybe like 1 in 1000 keystrokes it messes up -- if it was any less I'd probably just think it was user error, but I've been typing a very long time and I can tell when I type something correctly and the keyboard tosses in an extra letter. Even just typing this sentence, it added an extra c in correctly and an extra s at the end of this and I had to go back and fix them.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact, good key travel (touch) and backlight works well.
reviewText: The "s" and "g" on may M1 MacBook Pro quite responding and before I could get it to Apple I spilled some liquid on it which met it wouldn't qualify for warranty. I tried the Macally full size USB keyboard I had for my Mac Mini but it was too cumbersome, the key travel is too long and it lacked backlighting. The SATECHI is compact and the key travel is very close to the same as the MacBook Pro and the backlighting works well.I purchase the SATECHI mouse at the same time. The mouse connector is quite a bit longer than the keyboard connector and doesn't fit as snuggly in the port. (see image) The mouse works OK but I prefer the feel and responsiveness of my Microsoft mini laser mouse.The cables for both the mouse and keyboard are pretty stiff which means they don't lay flat and look a messy on the desk.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nicely sized wired keyboard with sensitive keys
reviewText: I generally like this keyboard for its size and weight (it's sturdy enough, but not as sturdy as an Apple keyboard). In my pics you can see it's fairly thin and it features backlighting, if you want that (you can turn it off).I prefer a wired keyboard due to better response time and avoiding connection or battery issues, so I got this one. Overall I'm OK with it, but the keys are a bit too sensitive and have weak spring stiffness to them. During rapid typing, you can easily overtype a key and I find myself frequently hitting delete to edit typing errors that don't happen on my Apple keyboard at home. For this review I'm using my Apple keyboard and I've managed to avoid having to delete extra letters. If I was using the Satechi keyboard, I would've had to hit delete maybe 10 times by now. It can get annoying, but it's not a complete make or break sort of thing.After 7 months of use, my keyboard has a little fading on heavy use keys, but it's not glaring and you can't really tell in my pics. I like that the keys are black so I can avoid the nasty dirtied up look white keyboards easily get.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mac full keyboard replacement
reviewText: This is the best wired keyboard for mac (not a fan of bluetooth).Tried a few other brands, but this is the only one that has nice low-profile keys with good "action", and no-fuss wired connections.Only caveat is that it uses a USB-C jack... so not a problem if you have spare USB-C port. But a cheap USB-C to USB-A adapter is a good thing to get if you decide on this keyboard.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars High-quality, Apple compatible backlit kkeyboard except for ONE HHUGE DEEFECTT!!
reviewText: I received a replacement and that unit suffers the same problem with improper de-bounce. so you get lots of duplicated key-presses. A google search reveals a Macworld article titled "Satechi Aluminum Bluetooth Keyboard with Numeric Keypad review: A good Magic Keyboard alternative" Quote: //Keystrokes would sometimes repeat, making typing all but impossible. I found I could eradicate those issues on a PC if I kept it plugged in, but I had no such luck on a Mac. And at any rate, keeping a Bluetooth keyboard plugged in kind of defeats the point of a Bluetooth keyboard.//I HAVE THE WIRED W1 VERSIONIT"S IMPOSSIBLE TO USE BECAUSE OF KEY PRESS DUPLICATION .I contacted Satechi support and they replied that this device is only compatible with a 2018 or later Mac thunderbolt port, and I didn't read the fine print carefully. Yet Satechi offers a type-C to type-A adapter!According to Satehchi, it's completely reasonable to require committing a 20 gigabit/s I/O port to a 5 bit/s keyboard and my-bad for misunderstanding how this technology works. Also, USB3 is not backwards compatible with previous USB, except when Satechi sells the converter?For fun, I tried it connecting these devices a to a PC type-C USB port and it caused an over-current condition and shut the port down.I am sending the original back to Amazon in exchange for this replacement, and I'm throwing the replacement in the trash and eating the $60 cost.Live and learn.* * *(This is typed on a Satechi Slim W1)Problem with inadequate de-bounce means lots of dupllicate characters. How cann the problem of de-bounce still not bee be solved!! Did I inntend to type these dups? Or is the keyboard adding them on itss own?Too bad because the kkeybooard iss very good ootherwise.Excellent mmaterials and quality feel.Apple layout with helpful labelling of alt/opt key for Windows part time usse.Stable feet are properly grippy.Backlight is excelllent. Note that the backlight adjustment keys are in the Apple standard location but do not inntegrate with the Apple keyboard driver. The backlight adjustment is handled internally in 4 appropriately spaced steps. BBut this also meanns that 'fn' kkey functionnality is not Apple compatible. These are minor compprommisses.Too bad about debounce nnot working properly. This is an literally an '80s PC problem!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Use floating keyboard on Android!
reviewText: *UPDATED REVIEW* So, I have issues with a Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra while using the fixed keyboard, but fixed it by swapping to a floating keyboard. It works on all other devices extremely well and accurately! I saw other buyers having issues with the smaller keys by the folding portions, but with a little familiarization, it's not a problem and you adjust quickly! This device honestly makes it easier to type on tablets with oversized keyboards, or cell phones with the infamous "thisnisbwhat happensbwhen Intype" design flaw. I highly recommend this device! My only suggestion on product improvement, is the ability to lock into a flat form while unfolded... the outward curve is a little odd when resting in your lap.Customer service for this company is great, by the way! They addressed my issues promptly and offered me a refund, but a refund is not necessary... it just took a little product familiarization. Great buying experience overall! They've 100% earned my respect and will buy from them again!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!
reviewText: Amazon is the wild west of retail. I enjoy the freedom to choose, but can be a mixed bag. This little keyboard is one of the good ones. There's nothing like it with more well-known brands.It's perfect for more my use-case. I wanted something small to tuck out of the way when not in use to control a mini PC behind a monitor that will be running a PowerPoint on a loop. I'll only occasionally need to interact with the PC. This keyboard connected with zero issues and even wakes the PC from sleep via Bluetooth.I'm kinda a keyboard snob and thought even the keystroke travel felt decent especially for the size.The only issue I found is there isn't a dedicated 'esc' key (it's an alt function of a shared key), it wasn't working while in a PowerPoint presentation.Overall, I'd happily use this over a touchscreen keyboard on a tablet for heavier typing tasks. I'm using it with a Stick PC. You could carry around a full desktop version of Windows capable PC literally in your pocket. The future isn't all bad.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product at a Great Price
reviewText: I recently purchased the Ultra Slim Bluetooth Keyboard, and I must say it has exceeded my expectations. This keyboard has turned my son’s ipad into a laptop and enabled me to actually get some work done while he is doing his homework.Key Features:*Quiet - the keys don’t clack loudly, which is great for using in public places*Slim profile - perfect for tablets*Great connectivity - don’t have to worry about wires and stays connected via bluetoothQuality:The build quality is nothing extraordinary, but it feels solid for how little I paid for it. It is pretty thin, which is a positive and something I wanted, but also means it does have a flimsy feel. However, I’m not worried that my teenage son will be carrying it around and using it for school. I think it will hold up just fine.Performance:I am thoroughly impressed with its performance. So far it has not lost connectivity and I haven’t had to charge it yet, which means it has held it’s charge for over a week of use.Design:My son loves the sleek design. It’s so thin, thinner than I realized through the item description. The colorful keys is a nice touch and adds a bit of personality. It’s also just wide enough for an ipad, but the keys still feel comfortable—there’s enough space between the keys to make typing feel natural.Ease of Use:One of the standout features is how user-friendly it is. Even for someone like my son who is not tech-savvy, this Ultra Slim Bluetooth Keyboard was easy to set up and use right out of the box.Value for Money:Considering the quality, performance, and design, this bluetooth keyboard offers exceptional value for money. It was so cheap I was afraid it would not last long, but after using it for awhile, I feel confident it will serve us well.Conclusion:In conclusion, I highly recommend the Ultra Slim Bluetooth Keyboard to anyone looking for a reliable, high-quality, small bluetooth keyboard.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Didin't expect much, very surprised........
reviewText: I have to say, for the price I really wasn't expecting much. However, much to my surprise it works surprisingly well. It charges real quick, as in less than an hour via the included USB cord (wish there was a charging block, but apparently most products don't come with them anymore). Size is great as it can slip into a pouch of a briefcase, or a womans purse realitively easy. Buttons seem to be well made and the spring under the keys isn't too stiff, but not weak either. Connecting the keyboad to the table was simple, press the "connect" button on the keyboard and then locate it on the Bluetooth device screen on your tablet. Eazy Peazy.There is however sitll the need to hit the send button on the screen. But thats really just a minor inconvience. One question I'm sure people are wondering is "Is there a lag time between when a button is pressed and when the letter shows up on the screen?". I can honestly say that I can not see any lag between the two devices.Final thoughts:For less than $15, you really can't go wrong with this keyboard if you use a tablet a lot instead of a PC or Laptop PC. Its much nicer than using your finger on the screen to be honest, or at least it is for me. For whatever reason my Tablet seems to struggle keeping up with keystrokes on the touch screen.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality Compact Keyboard/Trackpad
reviewText: Pros* Small total size* Pretty comfortable to use nevertheless* Convenient storage space for wireless USB connector when not in useCons* Takes time to get used to layout of the lesser-used keysOther thoughtsI teach computer science. I had enough spare parts lying around to setup a debugging kiosk for students to load their code on a big screen, except the stand couldn't hold both a standard keyboard and mousepad. This little gem from Vilros was all I needed. Apart from hunting around for keys like insert and delete, it's been smooth sailing. I wouldn't want this as my main keyboard for composing long essays on a routine basis, but if space is at a prime, you won't go wrong with this choice. It's also nice that you can swap between wired and wireless. Most little keyboards are wireless only, but the Vilros model lets you go wired so you never run into a dead battery.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars EDJO's ergonomic wireless keyboard is a game-changer for comfort and productivity
reviewText: I am absolutely thrilled with my EDJO Ergonomic Wireless Keyboard! The ergonomic design is simply superb. The split keyboard layout and the cushioned wrist rest provide exceptional comfort, allowing me to type for hours without any strain or discomfort. This has made a significant difference in my productivity and overall well-being during long work sessions. Seamless Bluetooth/2.4G connectivity across all my devices makes multitasking effortless. The rechargeable battery lasts for quite a good time, eliminating the hassle of frequent charging. This keyboard has exceeded my expectations with its comfort, versatility, and outstanding performance. A must-have for anyone prioritizing ergonomic design and productivity!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No more wrist pain
reviewText: This keyboard was designed well. I have no more wrist pain and typing is made easier.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good, but a few annoying flaws
reviewText: Works great, like the soft keys and ergonomic design. Two issues for me, but it's just my personal opinion :-)1) No CTRL key on the right side of the keyboard. I use CTRL-Y often and not having the CTRL on the same side as the Y makes it a 2-handed move, not 1-hand.2) The Delete button is right next to the Bluetooth button. I'm constantly accidently clicking the 2.4G Bluetooth button and disconnecting the keyboard. Wish there wasn't a button right next to Delete, woudl be easier to "find" without looking.Again, other than those two little things, it works great.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keyboard is tight and missing Home key
reviewText: If you are a fast 10 finger typer and use your right pinky finger a lot, The 2.4G Bluetooth button is right next to the delete button and I am constantly clicking the 2.4G Bluetooth button and disconnecting the session. There is no "home" and "end" key, so if you're used to use keyboard functions you need to get used to a combination of the ctrl and shift + arrows to do what you are used to. The keyboard is compact so it will save desk space. Otherwise, this is a fairly nice, good quality keyboard, comes with a dongle for the wireless connection to the keyboard and a charging cable. HOWEVER, the customer service at this store is superb! I did not only get instructions on the use of the keyboard, they accepted my return and refund, they also offered me an option of repaying me back the money again for my troubles or replacing the keyboard for free. I was completely floored by their treatment! So even though this keyboard wasn’t for me, I would still recommend it since it was a nice little keyboard!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Just because it's compatible with a Mac, doesn't mean it works. It's really for a PC.
reviewText: The keyboard keys are not the same as a Mac. Command + V gets you a checkmark, not a paste. Back to the drawing board to find a good ergonomic keyboard for my Macbook. This keyboard arrived quickly and was well packaged and so easy to hook up and was already charged! The keys are smooth but the best feature is the wrist rest. It is very soft. I do feel like the keyboard should be able to be adjusted higher. When you lift the tabs on the back to make the keyboard higher to give a better slant, the increase is minimal. The reason I am returning it is because the keyboard shortcuts on the Mac are not the same. The keyboard is really labeled for a PC but they added some additional stickers like it can do both but Command + V gets you nowhere. Total deal breaker.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good, but missing critical keys
reviewText: Overall I quite like this keyboard. Key feel is firm and responsive, well separated, and slightly concave, making it easy to feel. No double letters or missed spaces common to many wireless keyboards. Ergonomics are not bad and tilt legs help customise to preference.Minor qualms are that the ergonomic curve is pretty flat, so it's not particularly ergonomic. The legs on the front are too short - I'd prefer to have it tilted more aggressively backwards like my MS Ergonomic keyboard. I also dislike the up/down arrow keys being minimised and centered. The upper arrow **needs** to be above the side arrows, even if slightly. I use arrow keys a lot for moving around spreadsheets and documents and this makes it unnecessarily challenging. It makes far more sense to make the left/right arrows smaller instead.I can live with these as this is a secondary keyboard that floats around the house when I mix up my work space. However, two critical dedicated keys are missing from this keyboard - the home and end keys, which I use constantly. Yes, you can use them as alternative keys on the num pad, but I'm often also entering numbers, so it's frustrating to keep switching it on and off. I notice the absence of these frequently every time I use this board.These keys could be in place of the source switching keys above the numpad, and those could've been shrunk and located in the empty space in the middle of the keyboard under the indicator lights. With this layout it would be a 5 star product. As it stands, it's more of a 3.5.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is genuinely a fantastic keyboard.
reviewText: I've enjoyed virtually everything about this keyboard. It has both Bluetooth that can connect to two different devices with a button click. It also has a 2.4G connector with the connector dongle attached to the keyboard by a small magnetic holder! First time I've ever seen that. Very cool. I'm always losing these things.The keys are indented. This helps me find key centers without looking at the keyboard. The default angle of the keyboard is great and there is a satisfying dull click of completion on the keys when you are typing. You can feel when the key has engaged to send the letter to your computer. It's almost like a key press validation sensation.The only thing I would change would be to add a calculator button just because I use the calculator a lot. Otherwise, I wouldn't change a thing.

reviewText: This little keyboard is amazingly brilliant! It's streamlined and light, folds up neatly, and connects instantly. If you need a portable keyboard for your phone or tablet, this is it! The phone/tablet stand works well, and the whole thing feels fairly sturdy. I wouldn't stuff it in an overpacked backpack and carry it through a crowd, but for everyday use it's perfect.Be aware that you'll need a flat surface to set it up. Unlike other keyboards that you could use, say, in the car or in a waiting room, resting on your knees, this one requires a table or something solid.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost Perfect
reviewText: I purchased two different USB keyboards to try out, and found myself absolutely loving this little foldout. It works well and connectivity is simple and assured.Wishlist: It is plastic and not aluminum as listed. I would pay more for something built a bit more ruggedly with metal case and hinges. I like it enough to care. The foldout phone shelf: great idea! I wish it were deep enough to accommodate my phone in its case. I purchased a phone holder separately as a result.Overall, the design is brilliant and the keyboard is very functional. I like it so much, I would love to see the product produced with long-term use in mind. I will be using this all of the time.

reviewText: I'm going to write this review without correcting any istakes made by the keyboard. I assure you, i am doing my best to type as accrately as possible,,, wih no spelling errors. It is very light, and I can se it on my lap without discomfort. However, the u key is bent and sometimes rfuses to type. I also notice that when I am yping at a faster pace, some letters do reepeeat. While it is trivial to correct these mistakes, it is not helpful in a live text chat situation to continuously backtrack in order to correct istakes when others are already moving on from the previous topic. The bluetooth pairng also has to be reset almost every tme I pair the device bck up (reset, n this case, meaning to forget the device from the syste's bluetooth menu), which is rather interruptive if I want to type something right t that moment. It also disconnects after some inactivity, which I did not see specified in the uuser manual as a power saving feature - it only says it is supposed to trn off when the devie is closed. I will continue to use they keyboarrrd for a week, and if these problems do not improve with time, I will retrn it. I made an attempt to contact theee seller to see if these problems could be resolved, bt I did noot find the option nywhere, strangely enough.Anyway. The keyboard looks nice and does afford some usablitity I did not ave beforee, such as the arrow keys allowing for quicker corrections to text. The keyboard itself is not excessivey noisy, nor is ittt uncomfortably small. It IS small, but not in a way that impedes my typing. Hopefully the crret problems resolve theselves, because I do like the keyboarrd. I hope the nintentional typos speak for themselves as to the qualiity. I've nly had the keyboard - inside - for a little less than a day by the tme of writinng this review.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice Keyboard.....terrible instructions
reviewText: I love the form factor and great price. Solid keyboard - 5 stars for functionality... Ok maybe 4+. However...at first the keyboard wouldn't even turn on. I thought it was the batteries and after two sets I kept monkeying with the connections of the battery holder....and it finally turned on. Fine - no problem. Stuff like that happens. That's when realized the on-off light glows red...not green? Hmm - So - I read the ultra-brief 4-page 3 x 5 directions and it doesn't describe the three LED lights on the upper right of the keyboard. I have no idea what two of them do or what they should indicate. The instructions indicate that one of the lights will blink on and off if the battery is low. Mine was steady red. and is labeled "1". Not on or off but "1". What does "1" mean? Who knows. There are some instructions for the alt function keys - and the keyboard seems to work fine. For me - it has a great feel. It's just annoying that the engineers did a fine job - but the marketing guys couldn't put together better instructions. Even weirder - who ever thought we'd ever need instructions for a simple keyboard??? Also - there is an addition to the numerical pad on the key board "00". It's where the "0" normally is....so - you'll have to get used to that if you are used to using a keypad.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smooth typing keyboard - perofrms like higher priced ones.
reviewText: This keyboard feels like it is much more expensive than it really is. Here’s the breakdown:Pros: - Stylish: Rounded keys are a nice touch: sets it apart from other standard keyboards. - Low profile keys: fast actuation of switches - not great for heavy handed people, though. - Ability to have a solid backlight (not patterned) - a plus for me. - Quiet keys: not silent, but not clicky. Similar to Brown switches. - Has an on/off switch that is easily accessible. - Dedicated media control knob and buttons: volume up/down, play, pause, forward, back. - When taking photos, this keyboard's LED's were not flickering like my other keyboard. Better quality?Cons: - Key font is thin: Light coming through is not as bright as others. - Light feel: other mechanical keyboards are heavier, with a good heft. - Kickstand is not very high: approx. 5°-7° Not bad, but since it has low profile keys, the angle feels much lower. - The volume knob is small (10mm dia.) and feels a bit wobbly. - If you are not great at keyboarding, you may unintentionally activate other keys b/c of the lower profile. - Rounded keys are spaced closer together than standard square ones (approx. 1/8” or 3mm) versus my standard keyboard (approx. 1/4” or 6.5mm). Novices (like me) are bound to occasionally hit 2 keys at once.Photos show my current keyboard and my new ProtoArc (rounded keys). For the record, the lights show up brighter than they really are in the photos and they are on the maximum brightness level. I took some photos with the backlight off to show the actual font thickness compared to my old keyboard.Overall, a great keyboard for the price with a good, fluid feel.08/12/24:This is not a deal breaker, but I have one more "con". This keyboard does not "sync up" with my other ProtoArc USB dongles that I have (2 track ball mice). In other words, I need to have all 3 USB dongles connected to my laptop hub for all of my ProtoArc accessories to work. I wish they would have a system that allows all accessories to connect with each others' USB plugs - like Logitech. As I said, not a deal breaker, but it would free up some USB ports.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed
reviewText: Edit: Update after 10 months (2 star downgrade, then upgrade again):The keyboard starting acting up on me about 10 months into owning it and using pretty much daily for office work. Random keys started working only sporadically and no matter what I did I couldn't fix it. I ultimately contacted ProtoArc and after a little trouble shooting they ended up next-day shipping me a replacement keyboard at no charge. That's great customer service in my book and gives me confidence in buying ProtoArc products and recommending them. Buy this with confidence!Original Review:Gone through a lot of keyboards here in last few years. I'm not a gamer, but work from home full time and do a lot of typing as well as number entry. Once I tried mechanical keyboards I really liked them but found the noise, even with the quieter red switches with an extra o-ring were just too loud: any typing was clearly audible on conference calls and working at night would often wake my kids up who sleep in the next room. So I gave up and went back to a membrane keyboard (a high end one). But after a year of using that I was just never quite happy and after looking around a bit I ran across this and figured I would give it a go. Am very glad I did. I get the better typing experience of a mechancal keyboard but whatever they have done with the switches here they're definitely quieter than any other mechanical keyboard with the quietest switches available. These still make noise for sure and are louder than a membrane keyboard, but the noise is just enough to where its not disruptive. Very satisfying click and key travel is just right. I also find the orange F1-F4 keys are a nice feature: I'm in excel a lot so F2 and F4 are common use for me and while it took a little adjustment for the different spacing on this keyboard, it was quick and the keys are nice and visible even in peripheral vision so my eyes don't need to leave the screen. Battery life has been good so far for such a light (not a big battery) keyboard. I've been using daily for 2 weeks now using bluetooth connection and backlight on and have lost about 15% of charge. Backlighting is nice and keeps keys visible in low light without being distracting or harsh on the eyes. I would absolutely recommend this if you're looking for a solidly built, great typing experience, reasonably quiet, good battery life wireless mechanical keyboard. Checked all the boxes for me so I'll be keeping this one for quite a while.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Started out great. Then the problems started
reviewText: When I first got the keyboard, it was just what I wanted. I had stopped purchasing the Logitechs because of the butterfly key switches. I tried the Klim Chroma but the bluetooth connectivity was piss poor.Enter the K300.Mechanical - CheckGood connectivity - Check (More on this later)Lighted - CheckRechargeable - CheckThe one issue was that the left Ctrl key never worked properly. I had to jam it with force for it to register. Otherwise it was pretty good.A month in, it started having problems with sticky keys. I'd type a letter and it would go on forever. You could workaround this by turning off the keyboard and then turning it back on. This would work for a while and then the issue would come back. Well, over the last couple of months, it's become more and more frequent.The last straw with the keyboard started about two weeks ago. The Keyboard would go to sleep while I was using it! You'd see that the F3 would start blinking, meaning that the keyboard had lost connectivity and needed to be reconnected. The thing is, hitting the F3 key wouldn't restore connectivity. I had to literally punch the keyboard in order for it to register to reconnect. This would happen multiple times an hour. On top of that, the sticky key issue started occurring frequently too. I was done with this garbage.Thankfully, Logitech now offers exactly what I want. I hooked up my Corsair K55 while I waited for the Logitech MX Mechanical to arrive. I'm now typing this review from the Logitech. So far, so good.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I want to like this, but....
reviewText: Overall, this NULEA keyboard has a nice feel to it, but it does have some issues. Quiet, but responsive feedback typing. Squishy hand rest.My main (maybe deal breaker?) complaint...The ENTER key is abnormally small & the DELETE key is abnormally long & close to the enter key! Who designed this & decided to change standard design?The round "FN Lock" key in the middle of the keyboard is an important button. You need to have that on if you want to use the volume or brightness buttons on a Mac. At first didn't think any of those features were working.I bought this ergonomic keyboard for home use to get the feel of ergonomic typing while waiting for the one at work to arrive. I am now using a fabulous Logitech ergo keyboard & mouse at work. The Logitech is FANTASTIC (& pricey), but it is so easy to get used to. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good product .... some pitfalls
reviewText: I bought this to add to a ham radio (project) that I am in the process of developing. The project is based on a Raspberry Pi 4 computer so it has Bluetooth built in which had this item up & running fast. One thing that really bothered me is the so-called instruction sheet. It leaves a lot to beg and of course covered a multitude of languages that I will never use ...One point of contention I have so far is that I cannot find a way to hold down a key and then scroll down the screen. Yes I have a touch screen but its crammed by the programming of the radio so having a way to hold down a key or pad and then use the touch pad to scroll down the page would be nice....it may well be there but I haven't found it yet in the instruction sheet (too small for my old eyes to read comfortably) ... the case is plastic and my concern is that this radio is going to be used in the field and I have to wonder how well it will hold up there .... if it were made say in titanium or aluminum that would enhance its ruggedness in a filed application.On the good side it is amazinly easy to use, very good size for my needs, and has a really great touch feel for use. The compnay was very fast to ship and I highly recommend it for anyone who needs a nice portable keyboard with a number pad system ... I'm very happy with the unit.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight, Bluetooth connects easily
reviewText: Easy.to carry, comfortable to type on, silent keys. Worth it. I use with my Samsumg S9 Ultra tablet and to type notes on my Samsung Galaxy S24 cell phone. Blue tooth connects easily.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful first impression!
reviewText: EDIT: After using this for a couple of weeks I removed a star because some of the keys (particularly the "N") are prone to not getting typed, especially when I'm using the keyboard on my lap. Also, the numeric keypad is a great idea and works in a pinch, but I almost never get all the numbers I try to type in. The keys on the lower half of the keypad have a faint, but satisfying "click" when you press them, but the upper two tiers have no feedack at all. And it's all too common to press numbers that don't actually get input. This gets particularly frustrating because, since there is no physical way to distinguish the keys, you have to look at the keypad to use it, meaning you will not know until you look back at the screen whether the numbers have been entered correctly, and usually they will not have been.One thing I think is missing from most videos and photos is something representing the remake size of the keyboard, so I added a couple with my medium sized hand as reference.This device is wonderful out of the box, is easy to set up with multiple devices, and the TouchPad/NumPad works extremely well.I removed one star because it doesn't snap open, so it is unstable if you rest it on your lap - tends to fold back up in on itself. But for most common uses, this is a perfect keyboard/trackpad.
